description:
My wife and I stopped in here on Saturday and were happily surprised with the quality and service here.

I had the Spicy chicken sandwich with Franks, and the roll it was on was fantastic. The roll was perfectly toasted and the chicken charred nicely on the edges. 
My wife had the Avocado burger and thoroughly enjoyed it. We recommend either!
The perk was the bar of burger additions so you can add your own toppings - all fresh and plentiful.

It is well worth a stop in for that Saturday afternoon burger fix!
author: Lee D.

description:
This is my solid go-to place for burgers. Why?

-Huge burgers with free for all toppings bar
-The buns are so sturdy, not the wonderbread species 
-Hardworking couple
-There is backyard seating with cute lights at night 
-Nothing pretentious, retro styled 
-Price is pretty damn reasonable for SF
-I'm always in a food coma afterward
author: Stacey T.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday around 1:30 and ordered a 

plain meat and cheese burger with grilled onions got the burger and it was nicely done , patty was huge and semi greasy and bun was soft and onions were great the burger retained its heat for awhile. ProbBly better off split in two 

Chili cheese fries to go were good 

I would come back for a burger with extra American cheese , avocado, mushrooms  and onion rings and cheese fries
author: DOM d.

description: Clean spot... parking sucks... But it's all about the food... Burger was great!  Fires may need some rethinking... but i approve!  Will be coming back at a future lunch...
author: Paul G.

description:
My friend had a burger craving so we came upon this store in the Richmond neighborhood. He ordered the belly burger while I chose the 3 piece fish and chips with tartar sauce. 

My dish came with 3 large pieces of fish. However, the fish was covered in a bit too much batter. Seemed like there was more batter than fish at times. While crunchy on the top, the underside of the fish was soggy. The tartar sauce was fine, but I definitely enjoyed the fries! Crispy to perfection. 

My friend told me he generally enjoys the burgers at this joint, but today his belly burger (which came with bacon, cheese, mushrooms, etc) was a bit dry.

The interior of the restaurant felt a bit rundown, but they had a TV showing a basketball game, which was a plus for the sports fans! There was also a free condiments bar where one could load up and customize the lettuce, onions, and sauces for the burgers. Additionally the staff was very friendly. Fairly cheap prices but not my kind of place in the end.
author: Karen Y.

description:
Burgers are chargrilled and you put the fixings on your burger. Nice selection of veggies and condiments for my burger. The price was reasonable at about $7 for a cheeseburger. The chili was a tad bit peppery for my chili cheese fries but I still ate the whole plate of chili cheese fries. Restaurant is clean with a clean restroom, you can also watch a Giants game on the mounted television. There is metered parking lot within steps from the front door. Nice family owned establishment. The woman at the register was so kind and gave me a root beer refill before I hit the road back to the East Bay. 

I would return back to Belly for a quick bite.
author: Arasi H.

description:
Burger was awesome and cheap! Will come back!
This evening I got an avocado cheeseburger  Paid only 7-9 doll total, they put it in a nice plastic bag, in addition for free took ranch etc in any choice... Customer service was great, place is clean, food is fresh. Really liked this place, definitely coming back to try different type of burgers they sell, thanks!
author: Saikal K.

description: This place hits the spot every time I'm craving a burger after work. I always order to go, they pack your burger nicely in a to go box. There is a condiments bar so you can layer on your lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, sauces, etc. Quick and efficient service, delicious all around!
author: Annie L.

description: I was in the city craving some cheese fries and came across Belly. I went during an off time around 3pm and it was pretty dead. All I ordered were cheese fries and I had to wait 20 minutes.. luckily, the cheese fries were actually good. Overall, service was poor and food was decent. Will have to try the other items on the menu
author: Molly M.

description:
Cheeseburger craving was real today! After walking away from my visit to the post office, there it was. Got my craving taken care of.

This place hit the spot. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and a side of fries. I instantly regretted not getting curly fries until my food was ready and i ate a fry. Yeah...they were good. Crispy and oil soaked from the fryer. Naughty naughty, yummy yummy.

The burger was also tasty. Cooked a little more medium than medium rare but I wasn't complaining! 

The slice of cheese was thin so if you're looking for that cheesy cheeseburger taste - ask for an extra slice. I wasn't a fan of the bun, but other reviewers enjoy it so don't take my word on it. Thought the top was a little dry unless I saturated it with condiments or smashed it into the beef patty. I refrained. Speaking of condiments...they have a condiments bar so you can top it as you wish. For me that meant all the pickles and jalapeños! 

All in all, it hit the spot and it's nice to know it's there when I have to stop by the post office after work.
author: Jess G.

description: My family and I came to eat here and overall they thought the food tasted great, on the other hand customer service was a totally different story. I asked for a salad with no dressing because I'm vegan and I was told that my salad didn't have any dressing when you can clearly see in the pictures that it does. I took it back to the owner to let him know, but he accused me of adding the ranch dressing on the salad myself, didn't take it back, and basically didn't want to give us 12 new leaves with no ranch. We were having such a good time up until this moment, just think that he could try to be more understanding next time.
author: Demi A.

description: Best burger I've had in a long time. The onion rings were to die for. Amazing! You won't be disappointed.
author: Danielle M.

description: Burgers are very average, nothing to rave about.  Chili Cheese Fries were good and friendly service.
author: Sean S.

description: I'm here on vacation and it's been harder to find good places to eat on this side of SF that isn't mainly Asian cuisine. This was good! My gf and I bought Turkey burgers and some curly fries and it was tasty. Service was courteous! My iced tea was swapped out from my mistake not knowing it was unsweetened and I was offered a refill towards the end of my meal.  No regrets here, try it out!
author: Rick H.

description:
I'm over the moon for this place!!!! Seriously, INCREDIBLE tasting burger with topping perfection that you can add yourself. How much better does it get?? 

Who should visit with me? Don't bring too many people - not a lot of seating. 

Favorite thing about this place: The burgers taste like perfection, and then having the ability to top them with the perfect amount of each topping yourself is genius. And they have great topping options too!! And there is no limit to how much you can dress your burger with these toppings!! So it's great! They also have ice cream and root beer floats so yeah, DAMN GOOD! 

I'd love it more if: The food is amazing. It would be so cool if this place was just a little more cleaned up, but it adds to the character so I'm not complaining ;) 

Ambience/Location: Sort of a low-end decor going on in side, but it's cute. Very SF. The best food is found in the weirdest locations. 

Service: Awesome. You order at the counter and they cook up your burger perfectly for you. The flow of ordering and pickup isn't really great (kinda clumsy) but it works if it's not crowded in there.  But if anyone is in line you're tripping over them.

Tips: Get the bathroom key from the checkout area. 

Recommended Dish: All the burgers are incredible. I got an avocado burger that was excellent. Also the fries are awesome, and HUGE! We got one larger order for 4 people and still had some left over!
author: Bridgett W.

description: Two stars for the really nice man at the register & The strawberry shake. The fish and chips were not good they were crunchy on the outside and slimy on the inside. The burger patty tasted frozen and The chili cheese fries were lacking flavor, but the fries were good. I feel a little deceived by this four star rating.
author: Clint L.

description:
I misjudged this place and was blown away by how good their avocado cheeseburger is. I came here to eat dinner on a Thursday evening. I ordered an avocado cheeseburger ($7.35) and fries ($2.50). The cashier asked me what soda I wanted, but I said I just wanted a cup of water to drink. I don't know if the price he gave me was for a combo meal deal (burger, fries, and soda) but now that I calculated it, I guess I was charged for a soda; I don't know why though when I said I didn't want a soda. The total of my avocado cheeseburger and fries was $11.26.
I don't know how long it took for my burger to come out but it wasn't that long of a wait. When my order was called, I went up to the front to get it. There is also a condiment bar at the front where I added lettuce and got ketchup and mustard for my burger. 
I don't know what it is but this was one of the best burgers I've had. The meat was cooked perfectly and the fries tasted fresh and delicious. 
The refills for soda and water are free; you just have to go back up to the front and ask for it. If I'm around that area, I'll definitely come back for their cheeseburger and fries.
author: Kristin H.

description:
Great burgers, excellent dressing bar (peppers, veggies, etc). 

We each tried something different and all four of us loved our meals. I had a double cheese, my friend had a double no cheese, another had salmon, and the fourth had steak salad.

All of it was delicious.
author: Angeles W.

description: Love this place. Great burgers and live there friable family like customer service. Have been going here many time with kids and kids love them also.
author: Ahmed R.

description: They should really check their vegetables before putting it out for the customers. I notice this mouldy onion before I took a bite of my burger.
author: Eddie D.

description:
I love coming here!  Not necessarily for the food, which is pretty decent, but it's mostly for the employees who work here. They are very sweet, welcoming helpful and best of all...they offer free ice cream to children!  It's so cute. It's like being at home with your auntie and uncle. 

Food is reasonably priced, big quantity and have a condiment bar for you to pick.  And...it's conveniently located by the muni stop and everything else you need in life!
author: Me V.

description: Fast and adorable but not a place my husband and I would return. The garlic fires lacked flavor and I had two small strips of bacon on my bacon burger. I did appreciate the fact you can add on your own toppings and sauces.
author: Veronica S.

description: Complete rip off!!!! This is what a 7$ chili cheese dog apparently is these days. Don't waste your time or hard earned money. Prices posted on yelp are not the correct prices. The price of kraft singles and shitty canned chili must have went up because that's the only way they can charge such a premium price for this trash. Can't believe this place has 4 stars. Would give 0 stars if possible. Definitely better places than this disgrace.
author: Daniel G.

description: Found this place on Yelp while on our trip to San Francisco. I enjoyed being able to basically build your own burger - as well that they have vegetarian options. Overall, food was enjoyable.
author: Sanchez L.

description:
Great burgers, crappy salad.

We were in the area and found numerous eateries with 4/5 star reviews, but were in the mood for burgers. So we dropped in. The small dining room had plenty of seating since we arrived at the tail-end of the lunch rush.

The burgers were reasonably priced at less than $8 for a substantial burger, and a salad bar to pile on as much (or little) greenery as you desire. The burgers were slightly on the dry side but big, and the selection of salad greens and fixings were fresh and on the premium side--green leaf lettuce, pickled gherkin, red and sweet white onions were available, as were olives, spicy mustard, ranch dressing and sriracha mayo.

However, the grilled chicken salad was pathetic--barely grilled chicken atop tired lettuce and mushy cherry tomatoes. Fail.

In the end, we still think that this is first and foremost a burger place, and we are still an avid fan.
author: Lu-Shien T.

description: Burgers, chicken sandwiches, fish or shrimp and chips, salads... the right stuff to eat for our lunch or a quick bite.  All made up as you walk in or call up. Tastes great to me, and would def be back.
author: Julie S.

description: Me and my boyfriend ate here and he got the belly burger and loved it. I ordered the Spicy chicken sandwich and we shared curly fries. It was so good and it was really cheap too.
author: Amanda R.

description: Great place and food. There's outdoor seating as well. Very welcoming and helpful owner.
author: Tarek E.

description: Good food and service. Health score could improve as it was in the past. The decent prices make you come back.
author: Carlos G.

description: I've been coming here for a few years and it always been a good experience.  You order what you like and add the toppings yourself.  They have a TV that plays the usual sports games and extra seating in a patio outback if necessary.  There is a Bus stop right in front if you're taking the muni and has public parking lot next door. The owner is super nice and I would recommend giving them a try.
author: Joe R.

description:
Burgers made to order at a very reasonable price. A basic burger goes for $5.85 and ranges up to a double cheeseburger for $9.95. On top of that you get all the condiments and toppings that you want.

Condiments include tomatoes, lettuce, pineapple, onions, pickles, jalapeños, sprouts, olives, beans, chickpeas, relish and more. It's literally a salad bar of toppings to throw on your burger....oh and did I mention siracha mayo! Wow, loving it.

I got the belly burger, since it has mushrooms and grilled onions. It was great, cooked to order, medium rare.

No fries for me, but the curly fries look wonderful. They use thick wavy fries for the normal one.

Fountain drinks include refills.

Outside of burgers they have sandwiches, hotdogs, seafood, salad and some other sides.

Next time I may try the country fried chicken.
author: Masa K.

description:
I come here all the time when I have no idea where to eat, just like a place that you know would never mees up.
 Tasty, clean, friendly, good price, and what else do you need?
author: Louie Z.

description: This is a great place for a burger or other items on the menu. There is a generous condiment bar for your sandwich or salad. Owner Steve makes sure everyone is welcome. Once you go here you will be hooked. It's easy to get there by MUNI. Tell Steve TB sent you.
author: Tom B.

description: This place is awesome!!  Food was good, fresh and the I got everything for about 20 bucks. There's a little back yard patio thing going on and the family who owns it are super nice!!!
author: DEANNA W.

description: First time at time at Belly Burger! Visiting from out of town. I don't eat red meat so I opted for the turkey burger. It was okay. I've had better. My family enjoyed their beef burgers. I did like the option of picking your own toppings for your burger at the self serve counter.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Amazing service- very friendly staff. The man who worked there was so nice and the food was pretty good. The teriyaki chicken was pretty good. The service is friendly, proactive, overall wonderful and my salad was delicious. My chicken sandwich was also pretty good. Like the layout of adding on toppings to your sandwiches/burgers/etc.
author: Michelle K.

description: There burgers are the best, handmade patties, fresh toppings , by far one of my favorite burger places!!!
author: Kelly B.

description: Great burgers and bottled soda options. Quick and to the point customer service. Parking is tough but out of their control.
author: James C. B.

description:
Ordered a bacon cheese burger.
Very high quality and neat. You can not beat it for the price. Especially in SF!
author: Zack H.

description: Hit the spot, quick service, burger prep on the grill in front of u. Salad bar is great and they have Boylan Soda!
author: Ahmed S.

description: All you can top?  thin slices of red pepper, alfalfa sprouts, 3 different greens, pickles, cornichons, and chopped or sliced onions.  Now, what if they include tofu? One special ingredient per week. Featuring?  nacho chips? I went for the Belly burger with the cheese, bacon, mushroom, and grilled onions.  All my favorites. The Neiman no-antibiotic burger was juicy, actually it dripped while I was eating it. The bun was huge, I had wished that it would be brushed with butter.  It was crunchy and didn't disintegrate. Very cool!  The shake and root beer float sounded good.  They have sweet potato fries, garlic fries, chili fries, and curly fries, so many choices. Owner is so fast with taking orders, topping off drinks, and cleaning up the tables and he even washes his hands before coming back to the register.
author: Helen L.

description: Great burgers and shakes! Quick service excellent food and run & worked by the owners. I love the condiment bar that offers a ton of options to try on your burger or fish or chicken.
author: Gerard C.

description:
Very very underrated burger joint in SF. You could easily miss it driving down Geary, so keep an eye out for it when you're looking for a great meal at an affordable price.

I didn't try their belly burger, but went with the classic hamburger with a side of chili cheese fries. The fries were average. There was nothing wrong about it, but nothing great either. The burger, however, was of great quality and came from grass fed cows. The difference is absolutely noticeable, and the fresh condiments to compliment the burger were great as well.

On a side note, they should really consider changing the name of the place. "Belly" implies that the place sells fatty and unhealthy food, but it couldn't be further from the truth. Just a suggestion. :)
author: Kevin T.

description:
I hadn't eaten all day and was craving a burger and garlic fries. Since Belly was on the way home, the roommate and I stopped by to grab takeout. This was last Sunday, May 1st around 4:45pm.

*Belly burger: bacon, cheese, mushrooms, grilled onions ($7.95)
*Belly burger: bacon, cheese, mushrooms, grilled onions ($7.95), add Fried egg (+$1.35), Chili (+$1.50)
*Garlic fries ($3.95 large)
*Chili cheese fries ($4.99)
*Buffalo wings ($7.95 for 12 pieces)

I got the Belly burger as is since I love the listed toppings. It was okay. I wish the patty was thicker and juicer. It was slightly dry. I did see a sign after I ordered saying they offer kobe beef for an additional fee, but by that time, it was too late to change my order. I might have enjoyed the burger more had I gotten a kobe patty. The roommate seemed to enjoy his burger with the additional chili and egg. It made it a little more substantial. The condiment bar was fun, but there was only so much I could fit in the takeout container they gave us. The buffalo wings were standard. Meaty, but nothing special. I adore chili cheese fries, but I hate beans. I was happy when I saw the order since it looked like I wouldn't have to pick out any beans. However, after eating the fries, it seemed like the beans were mashed into the chili? It had a beany texture and taste which I didn't like. The garlic fries were good, but they actually resembled seasoned fries more than garlic fries.

After we got home, I notice our garlic fries were missing. The roommate left to go get them while I called Belly to let them know they were missing. The lady on the phone didn't seem to believe that I ordered and payed for the garlic fries. She checked her receipt and then confirmed we ordered them, but she still asked that the roomie bring the receipt with him. Since he left without it, I texted him the pic, but I thought that was a little distrustful. We were just there when it was empty and she looked at the receipt while I was on the phone.

Easy to grab takeout since it's on the way home, but I've had better burgers. I feel bad giving them 2 stars as this seems like a mom and pop shop and I'm all for that. But the food just wasn't that good. And that weirdness on the phone just threw me off.
author: Elena N.

description:
We came here for lunch. I ordered an Italian chicken sandwich combo meal. I got garlic fries with my sandwich. Sammy was ok. It was a bit dry at the ends but super yummy and big!

Garlic fries are delicious! Service was friendly. Not bad. The only thing is seating is rather limited. The three of us squeezed into a tiny table

Definitely do take out!
author: Wendy H.

description: Great burgers! Very reasonably priced for the Bay Area. Very nice staff. I loved the condiment bar and the food came out pretty quickly!
author: Rachel M.

description: Great burgers! Very fresh. Loved the topping bar and the idea of getting to put your own toppings on. The burger buns were great as well. Like a brioches burger buns. Curly fries were great too!
author: Sergio L.

description: Really great service, an expansive menu, and an awesome atmosphere for eating! Everything is fresh and organic, and the food comes fast and delicious. Parking is easy and the lot is right next door. You'll find everything you need at Belly! Great ice cream too!
author: Drea L.

description: To put it in simplest terms... burger was flat out amazing. Great quality, but needed more seasoning which is tolerable since they had salt n pepper readily available for you to shake it on your patty. You put however much condiments you like from the condiment bar and all the veggies were fresh. A little out dated decor, but the food makes up for it. Overall very satisfied with everything.
author: Miasnick M.

description: I got the steak Salad when I probably should have gotten a burger.  ok quality thin cut of steak but not trimming enough to cut onto a salad.  I continually had to take pieces of grissle out of my mouth.
author: John T.

description:
We ordered takeout here the other night. Normally I get the chicken strips and curly fries, which are delish and perfectly fried!

This time I got a grilled chicken sandwich. It was ok. I liked being able to choose my condiments, but there was just too much bread for my sandwich. They were also out of cheesy fries so I got cheese fries. They were good but the fries were kind of mushy.

In general I love this place, but I think some foods are better than others.
author: Larissa S.

description: Good place to have a casual bite. There are a lot of choice of the veg and they are fresh. I ordered its signature Belly Buger. It looked good. The patty was truly big. It is great to me as I'm a meat lover :) Having said that, besides the bacon and its price, I don't see much difference between it and other bugers on the menu. The only thing I think it can be improved is the speed of serving food. My hubby and I spent 30+ minutes just sitting and waiting for our food. Notice it applies to other customers as well. To be fair, the food is not bad, but the speed of serving food makes me think twice before i would bring any other friends here.
author: Diane X.

description: Fantastic burger on a delicious bun, one of the best I have ever had! I love that they use Niman Ranch beef. Excellent customer service, kid-friendly with a great little patio out back. Minus one star for meh (under-seasoned) garlic fries, and a less-than-stellar bathroom with no changing table.
author: Christina S.

description: Delicious, clean and you can pick as many, if not all, of the free toppings they have!! Very flavorful. Just wished they served more fries.
author: Nataly R.

description: Awesome, awesome place. Super straightforward. Order what you want and no extra fee for the condiments you choose to place on your burger. The burger patty itself isn't so special, in my opinion. Doesn't have much of a taste but definitely good enough for a burger fix.
author: Melissa T.

description: For the price, it's a pretty good deal.  There's a toppings bar, chock full of every freshly cut condiment you can imagine.  The lettuce was the freshest I've seen in years.  Being a French Fries aficionado, it was quite the letdown to be served pre-packed, frozen crinkle fries, when the image on Yelp clearly shows fresh-cut fries.  I simply abhor frozen, crinkle fries.  The Nestea tea was so unexpextedly watered down that there was only a hint of flavor.  Unfortunately, I won't be going back there.  Belly must've been a choice spot in its heyday.  But in its current state, expect a monumental disappointment in drink flavor and quality of side dishes.
author: Tony L.

description: Rushed in here for take out. Ordered the house salad with avocado and grilled chicken salad. Added on toppings from the fresh bar. These are very large salads.  Delicious and very well priced. Friendly staff. We will be back!
author: Bobbie D.

description:
Cons: 
Burger was too big for bun 
Alrite tasting bruger 
Payed 29$ and wouldn't give me two plastic containers for my food 
Ended up giving me a paper bag to put it into....

Pros 
Close to my house
author: Christopher W.

description: Came here for a late lunch after a long day of apartment shopping, and I must say I was impressed! I got an avocado burger and my boyfriend got the belly burger. We both loved our meals! Burgers were cooked fresh to order, and they come on a really good bun that didn't get soggy, even after adding a huge pile of toppings from the topping bar! These burgers are really an amazing value- for under $8 you can get a really tasty niman ranch burger and load it with as many topping as you want! Also, these burgers come on mini baking trays which I thought was genius considering how messy a great burger can be! Also, the service was good- everyone was very friendly, and the gentleman ringing us off offered us free water without us even asking! Overall, this place definitely exceeded our expectations and we will definitely be coming back.
author: Rachel D.

description:
We came here for lunch the other day, which is a rarity for us - we usually eat in.

The food was good, and you could definitely taste that the meat was high quality. You serve your own toppings from a bar which was a little bit novel and added to the experience. It was fun overall.

I did want to say, that I'm not sure why this only has one dollar sign on yelp. I think it should be rated as more expensive. We were hoping to have an inexpensive meal out, and it really became more money than you think. It's true, if you only order one thing, you will be under $10 per plate, but they seemed to nickel and dime everything, a specialty topping was more than a dollar for most of them and they even charge for a little bit of sauce. Burgers don't come with fries, and fries aren't cheap. For a whole meal, this place is definitely more than $ (I think of $ as In-N-Out prices).

Like I said, the food is good, we got the curly fries which were delicious and the meat was definitely high quality, but don't expect a $ total - plan for $$!
author: Hanna P.

description:
Really friendly family run place. Tasty classics. We had the belly burger, hot dogs, buffalo wings and fried chicken sandwich. They were all super tasty and the condiments bar is nice so you can choose what you want on your burger. 

In for a quick dinner with the kids and besides the good food the staff were able to charm my kids! Win/win!
author: Sunny E.

description:
Belly Burger was an unique surprise. they have a condiments bar where u can dress the burger urself. added just dijon mustard, tomato silce, lettuce, pickles.

eats: hamburger (7 oz, 5.85.)ordered medium rare
-partly med, partly med. rare, niman ranch meat
-patty bigger then bun, a little sloppy eating it.
-not juicy but meat red
3.5 stars, great value.

crumbs:
-many tables available for eat-in.
-fries, chicken burger, hot dogs available too.
author: Victor G.

description:
Belly serves solid burgers with a "toppings" bar (really, lettuce, tomato, onions, etc). Their burgers are cooked fresh which is good but can also take a little time - this definitely is not fast food. 

They offer a number of other paid toppings (avocado, bacon, cheese, etc) but a standard burger will run you $8 which is on the pricey side but the burgers are big and quality. I also love that they have curly fries.
author: Wendy L.

description: Really simple and straightforward menu. My son was a fan of the root beer float and I really enjoyed my burger. No fuss kinda place. Love the toppings bar. Everything looked fresh. Seating outdoors is an option on their back patio. Parking lot right next door.
author: Claudia C.

description: Best burger in town! Burgers are juicy but not greasy - doesn't leave your hands see-through. crispy buns. good sized patties and quality meat. good prices for this city at $7.35/ mushroom cheeseburger.
author: Will T.

description: This place is delicious !! Pretty cheap too .... hamburgers and the fish & chips are amazing. Very satisfied
author: Christian Z.

description: This place was so good. The buns were delicious, quality bread, man. The burgers are a decent size and  the chili fires were good, too. The best part? The prices, they felt just right, not over inflated like most places in the city.  I got a nice serving of avocado on my burger and my friend got the same with her bacon.  I like that you can self serve the basics onto your burger, as well,  because I love lettuce and pickles so I got to put as much as I wanted. The guy who helped us was really nice, too. I would definitely go back. Oh, and bonus!- there is a public parking lot right next to it, so easy parking.
author: J S.

description: This place makes me happy because they do a condiment bar. Their food is also simple and delicious. Good selection, too,
author: Alexandra R.

description: Decent, average burger. Not sure why there are so many stars. It's your typical, thin, frozen beef patty. The condiment bar is a nice add. Fair pricing.
author: Yen T.

description: We go out of our way to eat a Belly Burger. The place is clean and organized. We consistently get a great meal at a fair price. And, our business is appreciated! Great burgers, shakes, salads, chicken, steak sandwich...... love it all!
author: Mrs G.

description: It's good, it's quick, it's not a fine dining establishment but I like it for what it is. The topping bar is a nice touch to all you to add whatever you want to your burger. They have a ton of options so that's always nice. They have a patio but it's a bit worn down and kind of looks like you stumbled into someone's backyard when they weren't expecting you. The indoor seating isn't much more thrilling but it's simple, to the point, and allows you easier access to the topping bar. I will likely be back as this is an easy spot and you can get take out in 5-10 minutes.
author: A R.

description: Delicious food and great service! Randomly came across this place with my family and loved if. Will definitely be back
author: Sabrina A.

description: Ordered the avocado burger combo and bf got the teriyaki burger combo with curly fries, they were super good!! The condiment bar was a plus! They had everything from lettuce, tomatoes, onions, to jalapeño peppers and pineapple. The food is made to order and it took about 15 minutes for our food to be out. Service was good. Definitely will be coming back!!
author: Maria L.

description: Belly has all the accoutrements to be a great burger joint ... Niman Ranch beef, BBQ griller, brioche buns, condiments bar, and a nice outdoor patio to dine. Unfortunately the burgers came out too dry and nothing in the condiment bar could make it juicy again. The sweet potato fries and onion rings were good but the garlic fries were a fail, probably from using the inferior garlic from China instead of the USA. It just didn't have that super garlicky flavor. The floats and milkshakes were good but didn't help to cut the dryness of the burgers. It wasn't that busy and the help wasn't very attentive. Would have been nice if the cook came by to see how we liked the food. If I go back, I'll prolly just order a float and sweet potato fries or onion rings.
author: Harry L.

description: I'm in heaven!! Sunny relaxing patio all to myself and weiner!! My favorite. This is bad I will be here everyday to get out of my office. And the wiener is delicious I think they use Costco weiner and bun yum yum
author: Karen T.

description: best in town! I love the DIY toppings bar. let's u customize your meal to ANYWAY u want! 5all day!
author: Philip C.

description:
A small shop off Geary and 22nd with a steady flow of people coming through.

You order your burger and they give it to you meat/bun and you put on the condiments yourself.  They provide two types of lettuce, tomatoes, 2 types of onions and serveral other random things like garbanzo beans. red beans, jalapenos, alfalfa sprout, etc., 

I have to say, their chicken sandwich was awesome. i'm trying to stay away from burgers but to me, if they can grill a good chicken breast, they probably make great hamburger patties. The fries that came with the combo were very good as well. The combos cost between $9 and $10 so it's reasonable for the area.

I will definitely be going back when I get a burger craving! They have some tasty sounding burgers!
author: Mel D.

description: Burgers are stacked!! Got the Belly Burger and it was amazing. Good buns toasted and perfectly cooked meat if asked for medium. Mushrooms and caramelized onions get an A+. Self condimants and toppings. Good place for hangout. Price is good for a big burger and fries.
author: Brandon W.

description: Just terrific. The burgers are a tad pricey, but they are huge and well worth the money. The selection of toppings is amazing. I mean, they even have three types of lettuce to choose from, and you can take as much as you want of everything. The portions of fries are always very generous as well. Above all else, the customer service is what keeps me coming back. I want to support this local spot because of the nice man behind the counter. He is very attentive and makes sure you have everything you need. This is what every family-owned restaurant should strive to be like.
author: Dorian K.

description:
Update after a year, 

I love the outdoor seating on a nice sunny day. The menu  good revamped in a good way more chicken and steak options .This place is my new lunch spit that I bring all my friends too.
author: Seaera T.

description:
Uhm? 

Pros:  city parking lot directly next door.
Buns are brioche-like
No screw-ups possible on condiments because it's DIY.
Patio in back pretty nice
Really good sfdph score ( like perfect)

Cons:  that was one dry, skinny burger same thickness as the pickle slice ( see photo) and onion ring order was skimpy ( 7 onion rings....really?) 
Well-done when I asked for medium ( contributing to the dry problem.)

Mayo not refrigerated so no thanks.

Conclusion:  Im probably not going back.
author: El B.

description: It is a small but great place. The burgers are tasty and you can add salads to taste. We did not have to wait long for the food, I recommend 100%. The avocadocheese burger its great, you have to try it.
author: Dani P.

description:
Just had the Belly burger. Perfectly cooked (medium = pink & juicy). Delicious. Priced right. Great fixins' bar if you're into that but the burger I had needed none of it.
Go there. That simple.
author: Bob M.

description: Best burger so far in SF. Beats any gourmet burger place in town, in my opinion. I got the belly burger and it was delicious. Customer service is excellent and the food came out pretty fast! The prices are also very reasonable. After coming here, I doubt I'll pay $12 for another mediocre "gourmet" burger in SF again. I'll be back when I have my next burger craving :)
author: Charlene F.

description:
I had the Belly Burger.  It was pretty good, but a few things were lacking.

Pros:
-the toppings bar is pretty nice.  I wish more burger joints provided this
-cheese, grilled onions, & bacon were nicely cooked and nice and gooey.  this was probably the highlight of the burger
-burger meat had a nice grilled flavor
-free soda refills
-solid price point
-back patio with outdoor seating

Cons:
-burger meat was well done... I didn't specify how I wanted it cooked though
-bun wasn't terrible, but too dry for me
-french fries were nothing to write home about

I would (and probably will) come back.
author: Kyle L.

description:
What a great place! My wife and I decided to escape the Sacramento heat with our kids by heading to Ocean Beach in the City. After playing on the beach and a hike down to the cave in the Sutro Bath ruins we decided to grab something to eat before hitting the road for the long ride home.

We decided to go to Belly Burgers (we might have stopped there in the past, we can't really remember). We arrived and ordered a couple of burgers, orders of fries (sweet potato and garlic), and drinks. The burgers are niman ranch beef with an option to "upgrade" to Kobe beef. I ordered one of each. We all enjoyed our meal. I was surprised how thin the patties are, but maybe it's because I've gotten used to the monster patties you get when you order at burger joints. 

Anyway, the cashier (possibly owner) was fantastic. Checked in on us several times to sure we had everything we wanted. And later when our 3 year-old threw down with an epic tantrum over ice cream, the cashier came over with a free bag of popcorn.

We will be back.
author: Santiago A.

description:
We were craving a burger after a long hike and usually, we'd end up at Roam, but decided to try something new. I yelped for all natural burgers and this place sounded perfect (especially because it's near my apt haha).

I decided to order the avocado cheeseburger and upgraded to a combo (+fries and a fountain or bottle drink) for only $2.95 more. The burgers were on the thin side and could have had a bit more flavor to it, but the brioche bun was so soft and you can add as many toppings as you like at the condiments bar. The burger and curly fries definitely hit the spot. The man working was really nice too. I'll be back next time I'm craving a burger and don't want to make the trek all the way to Roam or Super Duper.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Very good chicken burger! For many years I was passing by this burger place. Finally I have tried it. And the results are great! 

Tha place was clean and smelled with slightly  sweet taste of comfort food. 

Big, nicely toasted buns were not greasy. On the contrary it was delicious, soft and crunchy. 

Bacon on the burger was just ok. Not a gourmet variety. But it did not spoiled the dish. 
The ultimate test for a burger joint is the quality of sliced onion. 
If sliced and cared for poorly it will have that nasty metallic taste in your mouth. 

If  you keep it too long in a fridge it also will develop that so specific unpleasant taste. 
That was not the case. 
Obviously they knew how to handle the food and they got it down right. 

French fries were thick and crispy. 

I found my burger spot on Geary.
author: Xela H.

description:
I do not understand why Belly Burgers has four stars. I have been to Belly several times and each time I am left thinking, what did I just waste my money on?

My first encounter was to satisfy a drunken french fry craving after drinking at Blarney across the street. The fries were "so good" because I was "so drunk" that I stupidly raved about the place for weeks. 

Then I went back. Sober. It was just awful. The patty was thin, dry, and blackened, not to mention the restaurant was empty, the cashier was a dick, and it took over 10 minutes to cook the burger. The one pro is that uou can add whatever toppings you want (like avocado, a couple different types of lettuce, tomato, onions, etc) but all that  amounts to is a bunch of toppings inside a flimsy bun. And still I stopped in again! For the last time, it's just not worth it. 

Plus Turtle Tower is right down the street and even if you're not a soup person, you can grab a bahn mi to satisfy the carb / meat / veggie craving. Or just, you know, go to another burger spot in the city. Or make one at home which surely would be much better, even if you can't cook.
author: Crystal C.

description: Ohmagawd, the burgers are fantastic! And you should absolutely order a side of potatoe fries, those are absolutely delightful. Oh, and you should definitely come hungry :-)        af
author: Remy W.

description: Great burgers in the city with a cozy atmosphere, decent menu selection and yes, burgers. The toppings, meat  and sauce are delicious
author: Charlie G.

description: I crave this place and come here at least a few times a month. The owners always looks so happy to see us and genuinely take such pride in their business (and for good reason). If you're in the Richmond and craving a perfect burger or anything else, Belly Burgers is your spot!
author: Morgan B.

description:
Slightly above average burger place. I definitely did enjoy that it was grilled and not on a flat top. A lot of people rave about the condiment bar but really if I'm paying you that much for a burger I kind of expect you to build it for me. 

Will I go crazy and take extra lettuce or pickles? You know I would prefer you finish my burger and if I want extra pickles i will ask. That's not a major gripe just an observation. 

A gripe is the fries. Are these frozen potatoes? I hope not. I'm sure it is less expensive to buy a fresh potatoes and cut it up. 

The place is super clean which I appreciate in restaurants in the city and the service was ok. 

I will probably return to try something new if i am I the neighborhood but after I've tried other spots.
author: Angel G.

description:
Good for the value. There is also a nice variety on the menu. I really liked the toppings bar and that it includes pineapple! They also have vegetarian options which is a plus. 

Standard, reliable place for good eats. Not much more to say. 

It's not five stars because there is nothing too stand-out about it. I suppose if they had more exciting vegetarian options or something particularly outstanding it would be five stars.
author: Nani B.

description:
Went to Belly Burgers after a long bike ride and left pretty disappointed. The service (which I believe is comprised of the family that owns the place) was friendly, but seemed to not be able to get much right. I ordered a very straight-forward meal (spicy chicken sandwich combo) and they overcharged me by nearly $4. I mentioned it, they went back, re-rung it up and still overcharged me - this happened two more times before I decided to just pay the extra money because I was so hungry. Again, they were never rude, just bordering on incompetent. Also, when I asked for a recommendation the cashier literally couldn't give me one - she just shrugged and said she actually didn't love the burgers. 

The chicken sandwich was surprisingly unique in it's preparation (interesting bread choice), but overall fairly average. I do like the idea of the toppings bar, but it was messy and the toppings seemed to have been out for some time. The garlic fries were delicious though. 

Food was OK, service was poor - definitely wouldn't recommend.
author: Andres B.

description: The beeeessssttt!  Tastiest burger around.  Full customized burger topping bar and the sweetest customer service.  Grape soda is the bomb.  And get some soft serve ice cream.
author: Marlin D.

description:
This is the kind of place you go to if you want a simple, no frills, solid burger in the Richmond. I think this burger place is better than the other 3+ burger places in the area, and the man who works there is very nice! Of course if you want a fancy burger you can go to Umami or Roam, but it's going to be more expensive and the wait will probably be longer than Belly. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE Umami, but I don't have the time and money to go there all the time, and sometimes I just want a simple, delicious burger which is where Belly comes in. 

Belly has a DIY toppings bar, so you can load all those delicious veggies on your burger or not, do you. They have tons of toppings including sprouts (my fav!!), so I was a happy camper. All the veggies are fresh and crisp, just the way I like it. At the end of the bar they have your mayo, ketchup, mustard, etc. The burger itself is delicious, although the patty could be bigger. Not complaining though, because it's a bigger patty than other fast food joints. Many people are complaining about the garlic fries but I think they are amazing! They are cooked just right, crispy, and well seasoned. 

If you want a solid burger fast, come here!
author: Michelle Y.

description: I have found my new favorite hamburger in San Francisco. It had that perfect grilled flavor and came with a nice fluffy bun. This is the type of burger that doesn't need to hide behind bacon or avocado or even cheese but they sure have those and many more toppings as options if you want. A little thin, sure, but this burger didn't need any extra weight to deliver on flavor. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
So I went at this location lunchtime today. First of all I wanna say the parking is great, there's a parking lot right next to the restaurant. The food is not very expensive at all everything is really reasonable, 
BUT.... the meet in the burger was really offbrand/cheep, the cheese and bun was to. Good place to stop every once in a while.
author: Adam B.

description: Great stop out of traffic! Giants game on and the belly burger with curly fries yummmmaaayyy!!! 5 stars for me! And gentleman at the reg is super nice!
author: Ashley A.

description:
Belly burger is a fun concept. Fun and clean interior. Service was friendly. 
The burger its self was underwhelming. I ordered the avocado burger but it was lack luster. The Niman Ranch patty was a bit dry and flavorless. The  brioche bun was a bit on the dry side as well. I wish they could offer some different spreads, maybe a chipotle mayo or basically anything with some flavor. 


I might give this place another chance if I'm in the area again.
author: Lindsay J.

description:
Hands down my favorite place in the city to grab a turkey burger and curly fries. When you visit Belly, come hungry because the portions are huge. If you're not into turkey, the regular burgers are Niman Ranch grass fed beef and they also have veggie burgers on the menu. The condiment bar is stocked and always fresh. Service is always with a smile. You can't beat the price, for $10 I leave pleasantly stuffed every time, though I'm still hoping that one day I'll have enough room for ice cream ($1.89 for a scoop). 

If you head there on a warm day, the outdoor seating section in the back is a nice treat.
author: Danielle D.

description: This is a really good spot for a burger. They've got a good-sized menu (that includes selections for vegetarians), a condiment bar, service is quick, the staff are efficient and friendly, the restaurant is clean and they've got a patio out back. You can't ask for more. As for the prices, they are comparable to most of the other burger joints around town. The only problem is finding parking but that's typical of the Geary Boulevard corridor. Would recommend this one pretty highly.
author: Rabbit B.

description: In addition to my previous review, I want to make sure people know to order their onion rings!!
author: Shushannah A.

description: Wow! The juicy hamburgers are chargrilled to perfection. Delicious burgers and excellent service. The prices are low and there is an unlimited topping bar of fixings. Great place!!
author: Georgia R.

description:
One of my lunchtime staples. 

The owners are super friendly and genuinely care about how you are doing. It's like coming come for lunch. --- but the food is much better!
author: andrew m.

description: Best burger spot in the area, always fresh and not too greasy, plus it's the same price as Jack in the Box, so why wouldn't you come here.
author: J C.

description:
3.5
I'm my previous life, I would eat a burger fairly regularly, or as cravings hit.  
As of recently. I'm doing my best to carve out red meat to once a week. 

So as you can imagine, when I have a burger it better be legit.

Belly Burgers has a lot going for them.  They have parking, clean facilities, attentive staff, plenty of condiment options, fresh meat and amazingly soft brioche buns. YES, the buns make the burger in this case.

The only issue I have is the meat.  Pretty big piece to the burger equation, right?
I ordered the mini burger combo, and my patty was drowning in the brioche bun.  If they could somehow get these 2 items to be more equal in size, Belly Burger would be winning. I don't want extra bread, and I want a mini fatty burger ok? 

The gentleman behind the counter was very attentive, and the establishment was an interesting mix of diner and strip mall chic. 

Props to the non fast food burger option that is quick and fairly tasty.  Good takeout option for us people in the outer richmond.
author: Flor D.

description:
Been going here since first opened and love the place. Friendly family owned business always remembers my order - 3 piece fish and chips. On a rare occasion, I breakdown and eat red meat this is the place I go. Neiman Ranch free feed beef . Someone else complained about the quality, I am uncertain how. Love the "toppings' bar as you can design to your preference. Bill's on Clement is nasty this is the Richmond Burger Joint to go to. 

Call ahead and it's always ready !
author: Karen H.

description:
To quote Yelp's description of two stars:  "Meh. I've experienced better."

Just not all that good.  Pretty basic, pretty minimal, as in, "Let's put in the MINIMAL amount of effort required to make hamburgers and french fries and not one ounce of effort more."  I can't swear that the food comes from CostCo, but it feels like that, you know?  It feels very factory-like.

I was with four other people, so five of us all together.  We had burgers, fries, and salads with chicken.  None of it was very good, all of it felt like hospital cafeteria quality.  

Look, we live in SF.  We are used to good food.  We expect a higher level of taste and quality than other parts of the country.  If you're not willing to go that extra mile, if you're not willing to compete on the level that this city expects, maybe you should do something other than sell food to people.  Perhaps Electronics or Hardware is more up your alley.

Bottom line: I can think of about 10 better places to get burgers off the top of my head, including: Big Mouth Burger on Valencia Street, any of the BurgerMeister locations, Burger Joint (also on Valencia), Pearl's, Roam Artisan Burgers, the list goes on and on.  I would've included Greenburgers on the Lower Haight, but apparently they have closed down.  

If you can't, at the very least, MATCH what those other burger spots are doing, then don't bother.  Your lack of effort, your DISinterest in making people happy with the food you serve to them, is obvious and makes me think that you should be in a different line of work.
author: FoodDudeS F.

description:
Very satisfying late night. Big Burgers and a condiment bar full fixens... There is a Kobe upgrade and bottled Sodas in the fridge that dont have corn syrup.

Super nice customer service and a very enjoyable Burger, especially late night.
author: Michael D.

description: If you want a no frills type burger joint, this is your place. My burger came as a medium, so I'll probably ask for medium rare the next time. Condiments and toppings bar to build your burger with the standard lettuce, tomato, pickles, etc. A good neighborhood spot if you just want to get the job done.
author: Crystal S.

description: great for drop in lunch or burger cravings . Delic chili cheese fries tho . Need better seating n cold inside
author: Eugenia L.

description: Great atmosphere, cheap price, and a variety of good food.
author: Gabo A.

description:
Belly's is a solid burger joint out here in the avenues. I have tried a couple of their burgers all of which were very tasty and promptly made. 

The highlight for me would be the condiments bar! This is helpful for those who like to customize their burger themselves. 

The owner seems like a nice guy, always offering refills the moment you need them. I'm trying to eat a little more healthy these days but I definitely be back! 

Left one star off simply because it's not the most incredible burger place but for the price and convenience it's a great place for the hungry human.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
We had wandered around this place before and finally decided to go in today. We were not disappointed at all!

The decor is a little kitschy but comfortable and clean. I really like that they have a do-it-yourself condiment bar - I can't eat raw onions and half the time I order my burger somewhere without onions it still comes with it :( not here though! I noticed afterwards that you can get grilled onions on your burger and I might do that next time! You can also tell they use quality ground beef in the burgers.

My bf had the bacon cheeseburger and really enjoyed it. I had a plain cheeseburger and we split the fries. My sandwich was tasty too, with a nice "grilled" flavor. Yum! We will be back the next time we want a decent burger in this neighborhood.
author: Liz G.

description: Super delicious! Burger was amazing and the fries are just right. The m milkshake is made right there and uses fresh ingredients. The topping bar for your burger is perfect, sometimes I like tomatoes and sometimes I don't, problem solved haha
author: Cheyenne S.

description:
Perfect!

I really enjoy this restaurant. 
The hot dogs have a great flavor, also the hamburgers are amazing, if you want you can get kobe beef! How awesome is that?
But what i really like is the opportunity to create you own burger.
they have kind of a salad bar where you can decide how much tomato, cucumber, salad or what ever you would like on your burger.
The same for the hot dogs.
Also the chicken wings are really great and hot ;)

The cashier is super friendly and is all the time aksing if you want to drink something more or if you need anything... great service!

So, you have to go there for a cheap awesome meal :D
author: Marco T.

description:
Good burgers (but for the best burger on Geary, I prefer Joe's down the street). They have a bunch of options for the burger itself (I got the teriyaki- yum), and then once it's cooked you assemble the toppings yourself from the wide variety in the condiment bar. Great for the picky or creative. The bun was really nice, perfectly toasted, fresh roll. 

They've also got good milkshakes, as well as chicken sandwiches and salads (didn't try those). French fries were average (I'm not a big fry fan).
author: Kelly T.

description:
I have had nothing but good food here. It's a build your own burger bar, which I love. Most people put way too little mayo and pickles, forget I asked for no tomato and think I like half a bottle of mustard on my burger. Here, you can make it however you like! They have interesting items like black olives, sprouts, chickpeas and pineapple that can make your burger exotic! 

I get the veggie burger which is always fresh & tasty (I dont know if they come frozen or are made fresh but they've always tasted great to me) and my husband gets the bacon cheeseburger. With a side of fries and onion rings respectively. The meals are the best deal so we usually throw in a soda too. 

It's a nice place to sit, never too busy, and there's a comfortable outdoor patio in the back as well.
author: Venus S.

description: This place is overpriced and the food is sub par at best. I would not recommend. The city has so many better food options than this place!
author: Amanda D.

description: Very nice ... Love their special the belly burger open condiments bar so you can load almost everything on your sandwich
author: Dezi J.

description:
Good food! Everything's fresh! You get to choose what kind of veggies to put in your food. The bun is different compared to your regular burger joint.  
Good prices! Friendly workers! Didn't get to eat in the back patio since it was late. And the bathroom was pretty clean
author: arlene c.

description:
NEEDS MORE AVOCADO.

Came here with 2 others and we ordered: 
Bacon Cheeseburger x1
Avocado Cheeseburger x1
Big Fishstick x1
Sweet Potato Fries x1
and a Side with a Coke

Took about 20 minutes for all our food to come out so now it was time to hit up the condiment bar. I must say, it's impressive. Everything was neat and clean and they even had a bunch of things that I would never expect (pineapple, watermelon, chopped up colored whoknowswhat). 

After we got our fixins, it was time to dig in! The burger was juicy but it was somewhat small.. The fries were decent, but I definitely had better. The fish sick was pretty big (it should be since it's $2.50) and tasted.. like how a regular fish stick tastes like. I was however, disappointed on how much avocado they put on my burger [http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/hZSUMUc_zrCmvS8mNvdkxw/l.jpg]. 

Overall, good burgers but expensive and not recommended for the big eater.
author: Albert L.

description: Big, juicy, tasty burgers for a reasonable price with a big, DIY topping bar. Friendly service and pretty quick cook time.
author: Sophie H.

description:
Pros:
* Meat tasted really fresh - makes for great burgers!
* All burgers were cooked properly!
* Yummy fixins
* Right next to my old fav. Video Cafe (r.i.p.)

Cons:
* Overpriced
* No flavor on the mushrooms
* Bacon was too fatty and seemed undercooked
* Gets really crowded - fast!
author: Bella B.

description: As fantastic as it gets. Burgers are great. Wings are perfect. And best of all, the Garlic fries are phenomenal.
author: Jose Maria Canuto G.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Burger = Quantity. Definitely. But quality was good.. not spectacular or anything... And you put your own toppings like lettuce tomato and sauce

SERVICE:
Nice asian guy doing pretty much everything... I dont' like the fact we have to build our own burgers. My food philosophy is restaurants should do all the work for you. Bc what's the point in paying to eat out then, eh?

ATMOSPHERE:
Small simple like a to go place.
author: Angela L.

description:
Its really just okay. the cool thing is that you get to pick what you want to stuff in from the buffet line. the man at the counter wasn't very friendly. patty was a little dry .
burger was a bit expensive 8 bucks..for maybe 1/3 lb.
cute name
author: Dee N.

description:
I've walked past this place on Geary a ton of times and was always curious to try it. Finally did today and was happy overall with the Hamburger I got. It's a bit pricey and was about 5.80-something for just the hamburger. The hamburger meat was sliced thin as well and wasn't all that filling. However, it was good quality meat and was cooked well. The bun was toasted and there is a condiment bar where you can personally add stuff onto your burger. Guy that made the burger took awhile to cook it, but it tasted good and he was friendly. He offered me a water cup when I didn't even ask which won him some points with me. A lot of places seem to hate it when you ask for water cups.

Anyways, the burger wasn't amazing for the price, but it was pretty good. I'd go again if I was nearby and wanted a freshly cooked burger.
author: youdontneedtoknow R.

description:
A no frills burger spot.  You want something grand? Don't hold back and straight up order the Belly Burger.  Don't miss on the delicious onion rings.  Nice condiment bar as well.

Great and friendly customer service. I went and picked it up, but its a nice little place inside to eat and watch a game on the TV.

A guilty pleasure and I will be back.
author: Jeffrey K.

description:
This place was just ok. The burger I got was mediocre at best. The fries tasted bland. 

Overall just an ok place. The cashier was really nice. I listened in as he advised someone who was vegan that his vegetarian burgers were not vegan friendly, and I silently admired his honesty for that. Otherwise, I would've just gave him two stars.
author: Victor C.

description: First time here after driving past it many times.  For about $10 you get about a 1/3lb flame broiled cheeseburger, fries, and any drink (specialty soda included).  A la cart burgers are about $6 - $10.  They have other non-beef choices as well.  Full self serve condiment bar to dress your sandwich.  Friendly service and an outdoor patio in the back.  If it weren't for my mother in law's home cooking, I think we would've been to Belly Burger many times before!
author: Vinny T.

description: Got the Classic burger for 6 bucks. I liked the seasoning, liked the sauce and liked the meat. It didn't blow my mind or anything but it was good. I thought it might be bigger, too but it disappointed me. I feel like this place wasn't too worth the expense or the line but the food truck is still solid. Therefore, I'd say 3.5 stars to you, Belly Burgers.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
If i was hungry and happen to be on Geary, I would drive to Bellys.   Great burger and SHAKES !  
The condiments are always fresh 
Clean restroom
author: Paul J.

description: I enjoy Belly Burger a lot. This place is always friendly and easily a quick grab. The burgers are big and if you're a picky eater you can customize it however you want. They have a good selection of drinks and their meat is all natural. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star is because it wasn't the most delicious burger I had, but it was very close. I don't give 5 stars often. Give Belly a try I'm sure you bound to like it because I do.
author: Shaneel A.

description: Incredible quality meat in the burger. Love how you can put your on toppings on. There's a lot to choose from and you can put as much as you want. Very friendly people.
author: Benji T.

description:
Service was good and so was the food. It was just what we needed before venturing out into Outside Lands. 

I ordered the sweet potato fries and my only response can be mmmmmmm.... Yup they were delicious and cut my fav way - into little disks. Like fat chips. 

My bro and friend each ordered the cheeeburger and being the ninja that I am, I managed to steal a bite frim each of them. I must say they were BOMB. The meat was done just right and they didn't even order the all natural kobe beef. 

I would definitley come again if I was in the area. My only complaint is that the prices are a little steep, but hey, in this day and age that's hardly uncommon.
author: Veronica D.

description: We live in South Africa and loved this burger joint. Curly fries, burgers & milkshakes totally on the money taste wise.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I love this place! I feel as if it's underrated because it's usually pretty empty whenever I find myself wandering in. I'm hoping that this review will get them one of those "People love us on Yelp!" stickers, because well..I'm a person, on yelp, and I love them!

The owner is always super nice, they use niman ranch beef for their burgers and the best part is you add your own toppings from the toppings/condiments bar. They have a good mix on their menu (the chili cheese dog is sooo good), and I like that they don't skimp on the avocado. I think they also use brioche buns which are really good. 

Their burgers are always cook perfect AND he makes an delicious milkshake!
author: Amanda S.
Steffie H.

description:
The choice of bun on a burger is easily overlooked and often overshadowed by premium meats and fresh toppings. 

That said, the buns they put on my belly burger were fantastic. They gave the burger a deceptively light refreshing feel. The belly burger was great with mushrooms and jalapenos from the toppings bar. For a small burger joint having average prices they deliver pretty well.
author: Jess E.

description: The service was fast and the fresh topping options were nice. Two thumbs up on the garlic fries! Not a bad choice for a good meal to stick with you.
author: Andrea M.

description: Decent place for burgers. Very clean and the staff is friendly. One flat screen tv in the joint is always playing the 49ers, Giants, Warriors, or Sharks if they're on. Minus one star because they have their mayo out and not on ice...gross.
author: Yelper F.

description: Solid neighborhood burger joint.  Better to eat in.  Flame broiled burgers are a bonus.
author: James C.

description: Belly I had just tried the burger place for the first time. The mushroom burger great tasting the mushrooms were cooked perfect. the burger was perfectly cooked and full flavor. It was nice to be able to make up my own toppings. Everything was fresh. Even the fry's cooked perfect and full flavor too. A must stop burger joint.
author: Joseph R.

description: Great place! Have been for lunch a few times and I will keep going back. Great burgers and sandwiches, lots of options for fries (including curly fries), and a full toppings bar for whatever you order (big plus!). The service is fantastic as the owners are very nice, polite, and care about their customers. Will be back again soon, if you are in the area don't hesitate to grab a bite to eat here!
author: Phillip M.

description: All the good food in the richmond, this is my least favorite spot by us. Burgers are flat and boring, fries subpar.
author: Blake S.

description: I love this place -- my daughter and I make it a near weekly visit. Always good food (and sustainable beef) which makes it our choice. There are a few burger shops in the hood, but this is our favorite.
author: Jill B.

description:
"Out of bacon." Say what?! At least I received an entire half of an avocado in the Avocado Cheeseburger. But still, is opening another package of bacon unacceptable?

Overall, the burger was decent but not memorable. Somewhat juicy, not totally dried out. Tip of the cap for slightly toasted buns. Nice selection of cheeses though I've been going with a standard cheddar as I tour the city's burger joints.

Now, all the condiments I can eat? Wellllll...that unlimited supply of burger toppings and saladesque veggies is only valuable if I have an unlimited demand for them. I don't understand the appeal. 

Said another way, the condiment bar would be more appealing if I wanted a side salad at a quick-serve chain restaurant. When's the last time you hoped for food that had been laid out for you several hours earlier? 

The fries were good, certainly. I'd order them again with confidence. 

One more note: why would a paper towel dispenser in a bathroom in the Richmond, of all places, have so much graffiti on it?
author: Mike H.

description: Just ordered 3 bacon cheeseburgers to go, Basically the only positive I can offer is that the bacon and cheese covering the burnt excuse for a patty, that was probably reheted from yesterday, made it somewhat edible. Topping bar is a joke too. I've lived in this neighborhood for years, and this was my first time trying Belly. Won't be gong back.
author: Katrina D.

description: Nothing magical, but still tasty.  I love that I get to pick my toppings.  The food is good and reasonably priced.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I went here a couple times by myself because I was starving. I like their burgers here and you basically serve yourself here, which is nice. I got their fries too. They have a television here where you can watch sports i think.
author: Serena Z.

description: Maybe because I went on a Monday, all the ingredients were leftovers and not fresh (a lot of small businesses do their ordering for the busy days Wednesday through Saturday).  The bun was stale & the meat was incredibly poor quality.  The two good things: our shakes were Deliciously thick, & I love having options in putting together my own creation (more this, less that, exactly how I want it).
author: JD D.

description: Ok place for a burger. Perks is that you can build your own burger with the toppings bar.  Fast and friendly.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: Yummy burgers, tasty fries and the best onion rings I've ever had.
author: Mary G.

description: I very much enjoyed their burgers! The buns are delightful brioche-like, and the meat was well-prepared to order. We couldn't get over how fresh they keep the condiment bar supplies, and how clean the counter person kept the seating area (perfect 100 health score!).
author: Sam W.

description:
This is one of the few places that weans my nostalgia for the east coast's Five Guys.  

There are some hasty and confused reviews talking about how the burgers come with nothing on them.....  there's a toppings bar (which is the only way to go with burgers, methinks), you order the cooked things and special stuff like avocado or bacon, then top it yourself.  

The price can add up, especially if you pay the 1.75 extra for the Kobe beef. but honestly it's probably for the best because if it were any cheaper I'd eat there 7 days a week and put myself into a burger coma since it seems to be the only red meat I get into these days.

If you get your order to go, I would recommend getting your bun on the side so it doesn't get soggy in transit.. you know how big burgers can get. 

Though I do wish there'd be something other than sports on the TV in there once in awhile, kind of a waste of a giant HD screen, imo.  Sports are like man soap operas; gotta keep the proles distracted, you know.

Anyways, definitely one of my favorites..  and it completely puts in-and-out to shame.  it's hard not to stop there every day since I step off the bus right in front of it coming home from class and work.
author: Eyre C.

description:
I had $7 in my pocket last Sunday (well, in cash anyway), and I was pecking around Clement trying to find a good and cheap place to use the $7 wisely. For some reason, none of the places I was looking at in the Outer Richmond part of Clement didn't strike my fancy then; I walked around for a good 15-30 minutes trying to make a decision....

Finally, I gave up on the search for Asian food, and I walked over to Belly Burger. Belly Burger: I'd seen this place plenty of times while sitting on the 38 bus (the bus stop is conveniently located in front of Belly Burger); the name intrigued me, and in general, I just had a burger craving come upon me after my lunchtime search. 

The place was a little quiet for a sunny Sunday afternoon; a basketball game was blaring on the flatscreen television, so it seemed to me like a "typical" burger place/sports bar kind of feeling (sans an actual bar). Ironically, the other customers that were eating in that day were women, all women...guys sauntered in later while I was eating, but they didn't stick around long. Interesting.

Well, despite my promise to myself to spend only $7 for my meal, I actually ended up spending $7.74 here, and had to use my card (luckily, Belly Burger accepts card). I went for the "Mini" Burger, which was 1/4lb of beef. This was considered a Mini! My impulsiveness also decided a side of fries (a HUGE side of fries) and a diet soda would serve me well for the burger lunch. I probably could have done without the fries, but hey, it was a satisfying meal.

Service was as good as counter-service could get for the time being: they rang up my order quickly, and then I waited about 5 minutes for them to toast the burger bun and cook the patty. The burger itself wasn't overly greasy, and sides/condiments were dressed on my own. I don't remember the prices at Fuddrucker's off the top of my head, but I assume the burgers at Belly are priced a little cheaper than Fuddrucker's.

The restaurant/seating area was relatively clean, none of the tables looked overly messy. Then again, I went while it was still early in the day, so I'm not sure how crazy the place becomes come nightfall. 

I'm not sure if I'll ever venture past the Mini Burger option, since it was a good enough size for me. However, I may go back to try one of the other selections, just to see how the thicker patties fare with my system. I'm not much of a burger person these days, but I don't mind the occasional visit to a burger joint.
author: Helene K.

description: I've been going here for a couple of years now. Service is quick and everything is very fresh. I especially like the condiments bar. It has a good assortment of fresh toppings so that I can make it my own way. They also have good WiFi although they don't have power outlets. Of course you shouldn't be camping out there so long as to need power in any case.
author: Gerry M.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Best burger ever ,there's so many different choices.I ended up getting the mushroom burger. you also get to put your own veggies ,sauces .The setup is very neat & clean, customer service was great!!! If you are in the richmond district ,want a juicy burger .I recommend you to come here.
author: Sarah B.

description: Came here and ordered the mushroom burger or something of that sort. Pretty good (but I was also really hungry). I don't remember if the burger came with fries or not but I remember the fries being just ok; nothing too special. Other than that, I wouldn't mind coming back again. The price is reasonable and the burger is good.
author: Lily W.

description: I love this place. The staff is very friendly and the food is great. Best fried chicken I've had in awhile!
author: McKenna G.

description:
I'm making my own Excellence in Burger Making awards and I am giving the prize for "Most Photogenic Patty" to Belly. If you've been blessed with a view of this fantastic piece of meat graced under beautiful San Francisco sunlight, you'll know what's up. Just look at my pictures!!!

Fortunately, Belly burgers doesn't just win shallow points, there's substance in every bite! So many bites that I didn't finish. 

Belly burgers are made of Angus beeef cooked on this big circular grill similar to the one they use at Mo's. Whatever that thing is, it makes super nice grill marks and it cooks my meat good! They don't ask you how you want your patty done, but it's medium by default. And it's a good medium that this medium rare eater here is happy with. 

The buns are buttered and toasted golden. It has a generous meat to burger ratio, which wins a truck of points in my book. It look me a long time to eat this burger, and my bun didn't get soggy.

The burgers are pretty much naked when you get them, unless you order cheese. I think they can work on the presentation of the toppings bar, Sliders do this too, but their offerings make Belly unique. There's alfalfa sprouts, which I love, and pineapple slices--which I have to go back and try.

I think for me, their fries is their weak point. I'm not really a fan of in-between fries, is it steak? or is it skinny? Not sure, but there were loads of it and I think it needs more crunch and flavor. 

There's a big lcd tv here so you won't be bored if you were out on a solo burger fix. I think Belly can also use a few more tables for better ambiance. 

So for now, I am leaving my review as a 4 until I do a back to back visit to Belly again and my favorite burger spot Bill's up the street. Don't worry tho, so far the results are lookin' fine.
author: Faffy L.

description:
Hot, delicious burgers topped off with the toppings of your choice.  Keep it simple or make it complex.  Put as little onto it or pile it high with your favorite fixings.

I finally found an opportunity to drop in this afternoon.  I ordered the Cheeseburger Combo #2 which came out to $8.08.  That's pretty inexpensive for a lot of food and a soft drink.  The posted weight of the burgers prior to cooking is 7 ounces, and they give you a gigantic order of fries to go with it.  You have your choice of cheese too.  I went with the Pepper Jack.  My burger and fries were ready in a little more than five minutes.  With lots of toppings to choose from ... I had alfalfa sprouts, fresh mushrooms, leaf lettuce and sliced tomato.  The burger was cooked a bit well; I would have preferred the meat just a tad redder, but this was an excellent burger.  There were so many fries I ended up wasting some.  

The lady who takes the orders and brings you your food was quite friendly.  The restroom was very clean also although the floor was a bit sticky.  There is a big screen television with the volume turned up so you can enjoy the sports programming, or you can catch up on the current events with several newspapers on a rack.  I'll be back.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: well lets face it finding a hella good burger in sf is hard, yes it is dont lie. What u say? In and out , yes dear but this isss fast fooda no? fast fooda no? Nway, i digress. I need to go to NY or chi town for a decent burger? Okay this place is okay, it aint great it aint shiteee, it is decent if you hungry like cow
author: SForiginal T.

description:
If based on burger alone, they'd get 5 stars.  Best burger I've had in the city, hands down.  I got the "Natural Beef" option for 75 cents more, only because I was frightened of the thought of eating Beef that is Not Natural...something about it just seemed weird.  

Anyhow, the fries were pretty good too.  Nothing to write home about, but they were big enough that you could taste the potato (I'm not a fan of shoestrings) and cooked perfectly.  

The add-your-own toppings thing is cool in theory, but this place is a little lacking in execution.  I say this because I just felt awkward all around when we chose to eat in the outdoor patio area.  We went back there and Gramma shuffled the kids out of sight (I'm guessing family, this place has to be family-owned) so I felt like I ruined the kids' play time.  Then when our burgers were brought out to us, we had to take them back inside to put condiments on them...and there's no table to set your plate down on whilst gathering your condiments.

The burger; however, makes up for all of that.  Had a tiny bit of char taste (in a good way) to it and the avocado was just the correct amount of ripe-ness :)   

Go to Belly and give them your money, because I'd like to see this place hang around (this is the 3rd business that's been in that spot since I moved here 2 years ago).
author: Courtney N.

description:
Belly has been a hot-spot destination for me since I first moved, and now that I no longer live in the area, I try to swing by whenever I do find myself in the neighborhood.

What really sets this place apart from most burger joints is the condiment bar -- want they have everything from jalapenos to sprouts to frickin' kidney beans. Don't want any of that on your burger? Cool, make yourself a side salad -- fo' free. Not too shabby. 

TL;DR -- Highlights include the Belly Burger combo meal (bacon, sauteed mushrooms, and your choice of cheese) and their curly fries. Also a prime spot to watch the local games as they always have their TV on.
author: Gabriel S.

description:
