A small place with a nice outside garden patio for a sunny day. It reminds me of Nation's the way it decorated. 

Service: 
Cashier was nice. Didn't rush us to order since we were standing there for a while deciding what to order. The cashier will call our your order when it's ready and he'll re-fill your soda for you when you ask. Other than that, there wasn't much service. But it's a burger place! so not much service is expected =)

Food: 

Hamburger - I loved it. Nice juicy patty that covered my bun perfectly. Maybe a little hangover, but that's even better! 

Mushroom Cheeseburger - My boyfriend said he really liked it. Good mushroom:beef:bun ratio. 

Chili Cheese Fries - FREAKING HUGE! A big helping of chili and cheese over those french fries with the ridges. (forgot what they were called) But it was really good. 

Onion Rings - I'm not a big fan of onion rings my self, but my boyfriend loves them. He said it was best he ever tasted. 

Prices: (including tax)
Decently priced. My meal of hamburger+chili cheese fries were about $10. But if you grab a hamburger combo (includes fries and soft drink) is only about $8. For the price, I think it's worth coming to this place.
author: Christina L.

description:
UNSANITARY!!!!    UNSANITARY!!!!    UNSANITARY!!!!    UNSANITARY!!!!

The cashier was eating sunflower seeds: putting a sunflower seed in his mouth, taking them it out of his mouth with his bare fingers, then discarding the shell onto a plate next to the cash register. There was a plate full of discarded shells just stacked on the counter in plain site- gross! This same guy was also handling cash!

Here's the best part: I then witnessed him grab some hamburger buns and place them on the flat top - WITHOUT WASHING HIS HANDS THAT WERE GOING IN AND OUT OF HIS MOUTH AND TOUCHING CASH! 

I asked him directly to wash his hands and give us new buns. He therefore rinsed his hands off in the sink for about 5 seconds (no soap) and never removed the buns from the flattop. I'm certain these were served to another customer. 

THEN - even after I told him to not touch our food after handling the cash...he continued to eat his seeds. Even though he stopped handling our food....still....eating on the line is unsanitary. 

If this is what is happening in the front of the house....imagine what goes on in the back of the house!

P.S. Overpriced for sub-par food. Definitely not a Pearls Burgers.
author: Andrew D.

description:
I am a local here, so it makes my opinion a bit biased. I couldn't tell you if I like this place better than Buffalo Burger (17th and Geary), but they are close. Buffalo has a fat variety, but the fries and Kobe burgers at Belly are amazing ($1.75 extra for the Kobe beef). Plus,it is a lot more filling than you would think.

My favorite part of Belly is the huge condiment bar where you can dress your own burger. I always get the avocado Kobe burger with bacon and jack cheese, and then I proceed to add alfalfa sprouts, tomatoes, and diced onions.

Good stuff. I highly recommend it.
author: J R.

description: The bun and fixings are very good but the meat contains a lot of gristle. If they can fix that it would be a good burger joint.
author: Steve D.

description: Ordered two mushroom burgers along with a side of fries to go. It didn't take that long to prepare and I like how they advertise they use natural ingredients. Anyway, the plasma tv screen showing a Golden State Warriors game was a good distraction while I was waiting for my order. The lady at the counter taking orders seemed nice and told me that the condiments were self-serve. Boy did that burger taste nice though. A nice meal after a good workout. You got me sold on the Angus meat. It was Belly good.
author: Gerard Y.

description: Yeah nothing to go wild about here. Just kind of is. Condiment bar is a plus, but other than that just kind of boring flat patties, weird cheese, small amounts of bacon and BBQ sauce. Saving grace might be that they have a good selection of fries; sweet potatoes, curly, regular and loaded. Still hard pressed to get me to come back.
author: Ezra B.

description: Great neighborhood spot for burgers with a great condiments bar where you can customize your burger.  Been coming here for years and the burgers are good and consistent.  Service is also great.
author: Piers Y.

description:
I find myself craving their California burger constantly. It's really fresh, the price is right, and they have great French fries.

It's interesting to notice how much people can expect out of a mere hamburger joint. If you're looking for a tasty burger to hit the spot, you'll find it here. If you want ambiance with your burger, go elsewhere.
author: Jane R.

description:
This is a family staple.  They use quality ingredients for the cost (ie Niman Ranch beef), making it great value.  

Condiment bar is stocked and gives you the ability to customize to your liking.  I load my burger with jalapenos.

Sweet potato fries have a hint of tempura batter so you get nice crisp withut being overly doughy or greasy.

Shakes are good, but you probably want to share one.
author: Mark F.

description:
Good burgers.
Put what you want on it.  
Good fries and other sides too.

I was sad when I moved away from this area, because it had just opened up!  And it's hard to find good burgers at a reasonable price in this city!
author: Fannie S.

description: A more accurate rating based on my recent experience is probably 3 1/2 stars. 4 for food- tasty and freshly cooked.  Prices are reasonable.  3 for service, which was minimal - the woman took our order, and called out our food items when they're ready. I was slightly put off by the fact that the receipt has a tip space and even listed calculations for 15%, 20%. It's not uncommon for burger joints to have tip space, but to list calculations is usually more appropriate for nicer restaurant. I felt uncomfortable and pressured into tipping as the woman who took my order stared at me while I signed my check. I have no issue with tipping, and I'm a generous tipper when I go to a sit down restaurant with good service, but an expectation to tip 15%+ at a burger joint where I pick up my own food and put away my trays etc after the meal seems unreasonable for me. The food was good though, solid comfort food.
author: Sarah W.

description: Literally the WORST Fish & Chips ever. It's hella eggy and weird. But all their burgers are amazing.
author: Art Attack SF G.

description:
Too bad football is over. Sundays at Belly Burger are AWESOME.
I love a good bacon cheeseburger and Bellys makes one of the best. Not to mention the fries are perfection!
There's even a patio area for the outdoorsy folk. 
But the thing that makes this place AMAZING is Ruby!!! She's the HBIC at Belly Burger on Sundays. Super cool and really friendly. 
Trust me, go to Bellys on Sunday, order yourself a nice juicy medium rare cheeseburger, sit down and enjoy the company.
author: Aron L.

description: I had a delicious burger here. It was huge and actually larger in diameter than the patty. I give the burger size four stars. Toppings were fresh.  Fries were pretty crispy, which is definitely what I look for in fries next to my burger. I called for take-out and was able to walk and have my burger ready within 5 minutes.
author: Austin P.

description:
A little pricey, but you get good, quick service with a salad bar for your burgers. They also provide huge portions of onion rings and/or fries, and serve kobe beef. I dig this spot because of the options, and the food is actually pretty good.

I've also tried their fish and chips which wasn't bad either.

BUT YES, I agree the price is a little crazy.. I think we paid like $10 for a bacon cheesburger or something close to that, so if you're hella cheap I wouldn't recommend this joint. However, they do a great job in providing a good burger how you want it.

This place is my go-to spot if I'm in the area and need a serious burger fix, but otherwise I go elsewhere (coughcoughPEARLScoughcough)
author: Tay R.

description:
I'm still an unapologetic omnivore who loves, loves, LOVES bacon, but after seeing "Food Inc." I've become a little more discerning with my food choices, especially red meat.  Specifically, it is extremely rare for me now to think about ordering a burger that didn't come from a free range and grass-fed cow free of antibiotics and full of smug.  Alright, maybe not all of that, but my point is my standards have gone up a bit in this regard.

Unfortunately there are few places that do this, at least for a reasonable price.  Luckily, Belly Burger is one of them, and even more luckily, I live nearby.  

The burger itself is fairly hefty, though you can also get a not-quite-as-hefty 4oz version for slightly less money.  I generally get mine with pepper jack and sometimes bacon (I never said I was perfect, and nope, not giving up the bacon) and avocado.  Grilled onions are also an option.  The cold toppings are available from a bar of sorts, including several types and cuts of lettuce, alfalfa sprouts, pineapples and beets...yeah, I don't bother with the beets or pineapples, but some people like them because they're still there.  

I'm not a big fan of the bun - for whatever reason, the bun falls apart too easily.  Not so much that it's a huge mess by the time you're done eating the burger, but enough to be slightly annoying.  The fries haven't left any particular impression on me, and I thought the onion rings were pretty average myself, although it's been awhile since I've tried them so maybe they've improved.  The owner is a really good guy, very friendly, and he does try to make people feel welcome and stay awhile.

The burger itself is a 3.5 due to the bun thing and the non-burger dishes are only so-so, but between the guilt-free status of the burger, the friendly local vibe and the price, this place deserves a solid 4 overall.
author: Sus... B.

description: OK burgers, service is a bit poor.   I've never actually eaten in the restaurant, as it's a little depressing in there... usually empty or with one person eating in silence in the corner.  I've also started to wonder why they never open on time.  My lunch hour is at 11AM -- when they claim they open -- and I can't count the number of times I've come by at 11:15... 11:30.. only to have the staff glare at me from inside when I try the (locked) door.
author: Heidi M.

description:
I think I choose poorly. Its like ordering chicken at a steak place and expecting something amazing. I ordered a hot dog and was enviously eying everyone else's burger! I have to go back and try to redeem myself and my expectations. 
The hot dog was ok - more sausage like than hot doggy and I don't like that it was split down the middle in order to get grilled up efficiently. I'd much rather have my dog wholly encased and unaltered save for a few grill marks. Just one gal's opinion. 
Nice TV - we were happily munching away as we caught the exciting Gold Medal Olympic Hockey game in which the US lost...boo.
author: Stacy T.

description:
alright, I admit..i was once again fooled by the exterior.  
I really do not like the tackiness of the exterior! It just did not look good to me.  Something about the font, something about the way it looks in general.  Ever since Arby's closed, even though that was quite a while ago, I have not stepped foot into that building...until very recently.

I was enticed by the fact that they served quality meat, so I closed my eyes and ventured in! (also yelp reviewers helped!)  As unwelcoming as the store front may look and as unattractive as the interior of the place may be, i must admit that they got quite decent food!

 It doesn't even matter if the place is not attractive to me, I will be coming back because I've been converted.  

I love that you can put whatever toppings/garnishes you want..that gives you so much more freedom to experiment! and I love experimenting with my food as much as I'm allowed to!  

I also tried their sweet potato fries! It's not like Elephant Bar's sweet potato fries but it's still pretty good!  You can tell most ingredients used are fresh! Pricing is relatively similar to other burger joints in the area but hey! they advertise that they use only quality meat!  

how many burger joints can say they use organic, free roaming, small farm, certified beef? The cows were treated humanely before being slaughtered...so i guess it makes it that much better!! 
(in a very strange way, I'd like to know that I ate a happy cow and not an abused, pissed off, disgruntled cow!!!)
author: Tu L.

description:
Recently we went into Belly Burger in the Richmond district.  The best thing about this place is they use Niman Ranch Angus Beef for their standard burgers.  Nice choice for your baseline burger.  Or you can even upgrade higher to a Kobe beef burger for $1.75 more.

They offer the burger a la carte or your can order a combo, which includes fries and a drink.  I tried the mushroom cheeseburger combo and my husband gets the bacon cheeseburger Kobe beef combo.  When you get your combo, they have a toppings bar where can select your toppings for lettuce, tomato & onion & condiments.  As much as you want too!

Stick with the fries for the combo.  When my husband substituted for the onion rings ($1 more), they were a bit greasy.  More grease than our stomachs could handle.  I guess it's worth trying once - but you've been forewarned.

From the number of reviews, more people would know about this place if they had a website.  I don't think anyone can resist the choice between Angus beef and Kobe beef.  Thanks Belly burger - it's our 2nd time this month & we will be back soon.
author: Janet H.

description:
Meh.

I wasn't impressed.  Don't get me wrong; prices aren't stellar but you get your burger's worth.  It's just that the burger itself it pretty lackluster.  The patty is fatty, and if you don't eat fast, the juices ruin the greasy bun.  Their garlic fries are nothing to write home about, 

Kudos for a decent condiment bar, but it's like eating at a smaller un-franchised version of Fuddruckers.
author: Sam W.

description:
In between visiting the de Young and Legion of Honor, I was looking for a spot to grab a cheap lunch and found Belly Burger on Yelp. Good call, fellow Yelpers! Belly Burger served up a pretty good--and filling--lunch, without costing me too many pennies.

I ordered the turkey burger, with Jack and bacon. You get to choose any cold toppings (lettuce, pickles, onions, etc.) from a condiment bar. I topped my burger with lettuce and Dijon mustard and mayo (mixed together for a quick and dirty ghetto Dijon mustard aioli). The burger was quite flavorful. The bacon was a little heavy on the fat vs. meat, but otherwise, was tasty too. I would have liked them to grill the turkey burgers on a separate grill from the beef burgers--I did get a hint of beefiness from my turkey burger.  I ordered the combo, with fries and a drink. The fries weren't bad--thick cut fries aren't my favorite, but these were pretty tasty and not too salty (a common risk at many burger places). My dining companions were likewise pleased with their burger and chicken salad, with generous portions of grilled chicken on the salad.

It's a small operation here (or at least it was on Tuesday), with only one server manning the register and the grill. We wound up waiting a while to actually order, and actually got our food pretty quickly, considering it was essentially a one-man show here. And the single server handled it all with grace, even when juggling multiple orders for dine-in and take-out.

Was this the best burger I've ever had? Not exactly. Better than most, I will say, but not the best. But it was just right for the chilly afternoon.
author: Raul N.

description: Pretty good place. You get more options and customization for your dollar than you do at In n Out. Will try again if I'm in the area.
author: Dan K.

description: My burger was a bit more well done than I requested, but it was still pretty good. I'm not sure of that was because I was hungry or just happy and satisfied that I was feeding my craving for a burger.
author: Tiffaney L.

description: All I wanted was a good ol regular hamburger and I'm glad I came here. It was fast, efficient, juicy, and once you get your burger you just put on all the toppings that you want on your own.
author: Diane L.

description: If you enjoy filling your burgers with lots of condiments, then stop by Belly Burgers. They offer a whole bar of extras, that you can stick inside of your burger. Their curly fries are good, and a good option if you get bored of eating regular fries.
author: Mars F.

description: Awesome burgers!!!!  I love this spot.  I live in the neighborhood and this is a perfect burger joint.  There burgers are delicious and always cooked to order.  The fact that you can get Kobe beef on your burger is awesome.  They have a great topping bar, with every condiment and vegetable that you can possibly want.  The Belly Burger is glorious.  Fries are great and the people that work there are always very friendly.  It's a great burger for a great price.  I always enjoy my meal at this restaurant.  Calling all burger lovers!!!!
author: Sara C.

description:
Typical burger joint...it's like a fusion between Buffalo Burger (on Geary and 17th) and Sliders (at Westlake Mall). Reason for this is because of several things:

1) Size of the burgers are decent and about the same as Buffalo's.

2) They have a rotating grill and free toppings bar just like Sliders.

3) Prices are about the same with the most expensive burger (Double Cheeseburger) at 11+; Combo pricing.

The really unique part of this burger joint is found in the back: Outside seating. 

The food itself is really like any typical burger joint. My patties were cooking with some pink, which I like, and the the toppings range from chopped lettuce and pickles to olives and pineapples. Pretty decent range to make your burger taste better.
author: Jeremy L.

description:
Well, it's rare that I ever give one stars to any place.  If that tells you how unsatisfied you'll feel and how much you'd probably feel more satisfied at Jack-In-The-Box for about a third of the price...

Ok, first off, there was no one at the restaurant except this older gentleman eating his burger in the front of the window.  It was probably about 8 pm?  Friend & I were hungry and decided to share an order of garlic fries and order ourselves a fish sandwich and the salmon steak sandwich.  

Ok, besides the fact no one was in the restaurant, it was a deep fried fish sandwich that took almost 20 minutes to make.  It was clear that the people in the back were speaking loudly in Cantonese and not making an effort in getting our food right.  The salmon steak was mega dry too.  Our fries came out last and it tasted like jack-in-the-box fries.  We paid 3something for it too.  WE GOT CURLY FRIES INSTEAD OF GARLIC.  The guy didn't even notice, but we were too hungry and irritated to say anything.  That's why we have this review here.  The only really decent part of the whole experience was a bar to get our own condiments.  The people weren't that friendly.  I was hoping it would've been a nice Japanese, Korean or any other ethnicity besides Cantonese & Vietnamese serving because I felt my service was equivalent to a Hong Kong Chinatown food place.  Bad service, loud people and late food.  

I will never return here and I would suggest to never eat at this crappy piece of shit place again.  If you're reading this and you work there, I would suggest to fix your shit up.  Plus cook your fucking food!
author: John H.

description:
As most of the reviews here say, the customer service here is superb.  I ordered the typical burger fries and a coke, and the owner told me there was a combo deal to save me a buck.  Considering how great the prices are already at this place, this was an added bonus.  If you're a sports fan, this is definitely the place to go.  They have big screen tv playing sports going on in the background.  I admit it was a little loud, but I was still able to read while I ate.  

As for the burgers themselves, they didn't stand out too much.  All burgers come with fries, which is nice, though the fries themselves have very little taste...underseasoned IMO.  Nothing special stood out about the taste of the burger, though it was tasty and the size was phenomenal for the price.  If anything maybe they could use more cheese selection instead of just plain ole American.

This is a place i would go to again for sure.  It has a great neighborhood feel, which is saying something given that cars are zooming past you on Geary. It's spotlessly clean, cozy and friendly, and they have a great topping bar if you like salad on your burgers.
author: Adam E.

description:
This place is on our family's rotation of takeout dinners.  The hamburgers are good quality meat and I like being able to put my own toppings on the burgers.  The onion rings are super yummy - crunchy and thick!  The fries are also good but the sweet potato fries are ok.  They are more cut into rounds than french fry style.

The service and staff are great and friendly.
author: Nan L.

description:
I've had this place on my list of burger joints to try out for some time. I was intrigued by the high ratings. Now Belly Burger is on another sort of list.

Everything from top to bottom is thoroughly unimpressive about this place. As many people have stated, the burgers taste like reheated, frozen patties. The fries taste like frozen from a bag. The corn dog tasted like the Foster Farms corn dogs you get at Safeway.

I usually give okay-ish places a second chance in case they were having an off day, but this meal was so mediocre I don't even want to waste my time. The best thing about my meal was the great water to syrup ratio on the soda.

For God's sake, Bill's is three blocks away. Walk there instead. I'd rather take three buses to the In-N-Out in Daly City than bother with this dud again.
author: Matt J.

description:
I really like this cafe and never found anything wrong with it. Hamburgers are big and tasty. Choose your own toppings ( some people overdo it and basically make a salad, literally)
In addition to burgers I tried onion rings, which were also very good.
I also really like the people who work here. They're very nice.

The only thing I would mention which doesn't have to with quality, is it's better to come here before 3 or after 5 because sometimes groups of loud middle or high school kids drop by.
author: Monkey C.

description:
My upstairs neighbor owns this place! We go once in a while when he works. Good burgers, I usually get a normal cheese burger because their topping bar satisfies my need for topping diversity. It kind of reminds me of sliders (don't tell my neighbor but I like sliders more it's just too far). Boyfriend gets the teriyaki burger, I can't recommend it one way or another since I never pair fruit with meat. 

Niman ranch, cant go wrong.
author: Jenn F.

description:
Have eaten here a few times when I work in the neighborhood and have the time to grab a bite.

The service is always very good, the place is clean and the food is fresh. 

I like the fresh condiments area.
author: King O.

description:
I was hesitant to eat here at first because the food didn't look THAT appetizing. I ordered the Chicken Teriyaki Sandwich and it was surprisingly, full of flavor! They put everything on such large plates that my plate looked so empty with such a small sandwich on it. I like that  there is a mini bar that you can put as much lettuce, tomato or other condiments that you feel go well with your food. I definitely loaded my sandwich up with mushrooms! They were so fresh and complimented my chicken teriyaki. 
My friend got the burger combo. Although he got fries with his burger, his plate still looked half full! The fries were okay. I felt that it needed more seasoning or flavor to it. 
The plus about eating this place is that afterwards, I felt light. I didn't feel like I gained a thousand pounds because the food was so oily. I think I would go back to this place if I didn't know where else to eat.
author: Katrina T.

description:
I've come here twice now and both times I was skeptical. Something about the decor out and in is just off-putting.

But, you know, I like the burger. I was STARVING both times I ate there and came out feeling refreshed, satisfied and overall, happy.

I'm really teetering towards lowering this rating down to 3 stars, but I think they need the benefit of the doubt to get people in the door to pass the evil spirits lurking outside. here here
author: Victor B.

description:
Good condiment bar. 
Quick service. 
A little pricey for a bacon chesse burger with avocado but what ISNT pricey in SF?
author: Courtney S.

description:
Great honest burger for around $5-$7.50, not including fries and a drink.  That puts a combo meal around $10, which is a little over my desired price range for a burger!  I feel like the burgers should be $1 cheaper.  

Nevertheless, the burgers are really good, and they use fresh ingredients which you put on yourself.  I love how they have SPROUTS!  My favorite :)
author: Justin L.

description:
I'd say 3.5 stars for the burger, and 4.5 stars for the rings. 

Since a lot of us have very strict criteria for our burgers, I'm gonna break it down to the nitty-grit... 

Meat: I ordered a cheeseburger cooked medium, and a reg. burger, medium. Both were pretty well done. Not burnt, but had no trace of pink. 
I prefer my burger truly medium (or med/rare.) If you don't know what that is, go to cooking school and learn. It's important. 

This meat doesn't have enough fat content to be cooked this much. When I make my own (or meatballs, or anything of this sort) I go to a good butcher (Whole Foods is decent) and get the ground chuck. 
It has the best flavor and a respectable fat content. If you're gonna do it - do it right. I appreciate that they serve natural Angus. 

Bun: basic seedless, white bun. Lightly toasted. (not enough) 
Meat-to-bun ratio: perfect? - almost too much beef (I prefer 1/4#, this is 1/3) but the meat is evenly shaped and reaches the end of the bun 

Rings: terrific. Thick, juicy slices of sweet onion with a paper-thin tempura batter. I like mine cooked just a bit longer (coating), but they really were wonderful. I smashed one into my burger to up the fat factor. 

Cheese: I was given American, which I don't hate, but would prefer Jack in this case. Not sure if they have a choice. The guy didn't give me one. 

Condiments: Considerate assortment of both leaf and chopped lettuce, white and red raw onion rings + chopped red, thinly sliced tomato (yay! hate thick), sprouts, carrots, black olives, garbanzo and kidney beans, relish. And in pumps or bottles: ketchup, mayo, yellow and deli mustard. 

Packaging: I could do without the plastic clamshell. I appreciate my burger being protected for the trip home, but c'mon now. Wake up and smell the landfill. 

Cleanliness: The place looked very clean and well-kept. The bathroom was also very clean. I was a bit put off when a customer came in with his (small, but still...) dog and actually ate there with the dog in the restaurant. The owner didn't bat an eyelash. The man was not blind or impaired in any way I could see (other than being selfish and rude.) 
I love dogs, but not in restaurants or stores while I'm shopping.
author: Blue R.

description:
I went there just because and was pleasantly surprised.  The meat tastes fresh and the topping bar is awesome.  The burgers are also quite large and the price is great for what you get.  

The fries do taste like the kind that are frozen in a bag but I go there for the burgers, not the fries.  It's a quaint little place and I highly recommend it especially since the beef they use is hormone free.
author: Angelica R.

description:
This place sorta reminds me of Clown Alley back in the days on Columbus and Jackson.  They make the burgers and you decide what kind of condiments you want on it.  Clown Alley, however, had fresh condiments while this place doesn't.  The onions were browning and the condiments didn't look fresh.  

They actually make their burgers pretty good.  I was actually surprised that it was that good.  They have a patio in the back but they gotta put away the tricycles and mini basketball hoop in the back.  Looks like a friends backyard picnic.  Great patio dining would be Barney's in the Marina.  Love them!!!

Overall............it was good.  What would make me want to come back?  Differentiate yourselfs.  Make bigger burgers.  Do one of those 5lb burgers..............if you can finish it  then it's free.  If you can't then it's 20 dollars.  hahahhah.. Just a thought.  Some kind of gimmick would be cool.  Clown alley use to have this double cheeseburger that was to die for.  Miss that restaurant.  I also liked it when the staff wore uniforms.  I don't know why.
author: jason g.

description:
A big burger with bacon, mushrooms, cheese, grilled onions, and a condiment bar. It also comes with fries and a good sized drink for $10. Parking lot on the side and a TV with sports. At least today with the World Series going on. If it had some booze and some people in there it would be even better. Ill be back soon. Here's a menu since they don't have a website. http://www.allmenus.com/ca/san-francisco/61979-belly-burgers/menu/
Matsbaseballtrip.blogspot.com
author: Mat F.

description: Decent, family-run neighborhood burger joint. There is a good condiment bar and for around $10, you can get a burger, fries, and a drink. They also offer sweet potato wedges and onion rings if you're not in the mood for fries. There's a TV hooked-up if you want to pop in for a bite and watch a bit of television (usually a game or news is on) while you eat. Fast take-out service!
author: Grayson E.

description:
For how close this place is to my house ,I am surprised I don't go here more often. 

I've only ever gotten the veggie burger and it's pretty damn good. They can't really mess up on the burger considering they only have to do the cooking part. You do the rest! I am not the biggest fan of food that is open for anyone to grab at, buffet style, but I can look past it for this place. French fries remind me of a place I use to go to when I was little. Very yummy. I love fries in general though. I recently saw they added sweet potato fries to the menu, going to have to try those soon!
author: Danielle K.

description: First off I'm from a small city on the Peninsula and I rarely go to SF! When I go I just hit the really loong streets and last night one of those streets was Geary! I looove burgers so when I saw the red lights I said yessssss! It's a simple place.. A few seats. I ordered the mushroom burger w cheese, medium well but to be honest when I bit into it it was over cooked. I'm ok with a well done burger so I was cool but it is nice to get what your paying for! It was juicy and seasoned well.. The fries were ok but next time I will try the onion rings. Some of you complain about the prices but if you were to go to carls jr or JITB you would be paying $8 for a meal! Atleast here you have a healthier choice.. All in all I'd go back but i wouldn't call it my go to burger spot!
author: R. M.

description: The hamburger I tried was yummy. Lovely layout where you get called to pick up your hamburger fresh off the grill on a large plate and then you put on the veggies yourself - really felt like I was at a summer backyard grilling party. Sports on the TV, friendly staff guy and not too busy. Pleasure to have dropped by when we were deciding between Bill's around the block.
author: Jan S.

description:
Belly Burger's got some of the most delicious, well-made burgers in the Richmond district, especially when you don't want to put up with fast food. Their hours are reasonable and service okay (no table service, and the cashier/waiter tends to be a little on the quiet side). Price-wise a burger and a drink or a combination (with fries) will set you back about $10, pricey for a "burger joint," but well-worth it considering the quality of ingredients.

My favorite's the Avocado Cheeseburger: the best of everything California, cooked right and sandwiched between two delicious, sesame seed-free buns. I've never had a single ill comment about the quality of the vegetables, condiments, or the way the meat was cooked or cheese was melted: no mushy burgers here!

It's small though, so if you go with friends or family, make it groups of four or less, or get your meal to go: there are only a few tables. Normally there's a radio or a TV on for "entertainment," but you'll probably spend most of your time absorbed in your delicious, custom-made burger, anyway.
author: Meredith S.

description: Though I live nearby, today was my first visit here and I really enjoyed it. When we ordered, I was a little dismayed that they did not ask how we wanted our burgers cooked (I am a bloody meat fan myself) but all my doubts were set aside when I took the first bite. Delicious. The flavor of the Niman Ranch beef really came through and the bun was very tasty. I ordered the avocado on my burger and got an entire half an avocado on it. The onion rings were crispy and spot on. While it was a little pricey for a burger joint, the food was cooked fast and tasted great.
author: Raymond P.

description: I love this place.  They use really fresh meat that is cooked to perfections.  Their condiment bar is well kept and impressive.  The seasoning on their fries is pretty good.  Everything is priced highly, but for what they give you, I think its worth it!
author: Praise C.

description:
Fair warning this review of a burger place is written by a vegetarian. I had fish and chips which were great but I regretted out of guilt about eating fish. Everyone else had a cheese burger and fries. They all said the burgers were great. I can attest to the fries being A-1. So you may be asking why not a four star rating. 
  Well the place was freezing inside, I had to go back to the car to get extra warm gear so I could eat. We had three kids with us and they wanted their coats. The tables and chairs all needed a good wipe down and the floor needed to be picked up. It wasn't busy so I'm not sure what the deal was about cleaning. It was also very pricey for burgers. I would have a hard time spending that much here again. They need to add a kid burger to the menu.
author: Stella N.

description:
Here's the deal -- If you've read my previous reviews (of course you haven't), you'll know I have a thing about fries. To wit: a french fry is a piece of a waxy potato, otherwise unadulterated, that is cut into a straight strip and deep-fried in oil. It is not coated, reconstituted, pre-spiced, curled or fucked with in any way beforehand. If you want to add stuff afterwards - be it ketchup, mayo, vinegar, cheese, gravy - hey, that's your kink...do it up. But when it gets to your plate, it's virginal.

So...the fries at this place (10 days old and I'm still reviewer #2...the power of Yelp!) are ideal. And as the reviewer before me mentioned, you get a ton with the combo. If you eat in-house, your combo comes on a plastic tray (Yes, with a wax paper tray liner, relax) and any room not filled with burger is generally filled with fries.

The burger is also excellent. Again, in reference to the first reviewer, i did ask for medium rare and got it that way. It's pretty big too, and you get to pick your own toppings at the toppings' bar' or whatever it's called.

They also toast and butter the bun. This is crucial to keeping a juicy burger this big together for the whole meal. Good work!

There were other things on the menu (salads etc) but I can't vouch for them. Use the maxim that says, when determining what to order at a particular restaurant, "order whatever's on the biggest neon sign." In this case, that means "burger". 

Also, on the first reviewer's subject of what this place was before...when I moved to the Richmond 2 years ago, it was the saddest Arby's in the world. I ate there twice -- the first time because I loved Arby's as a kid, the second time to see if the place was nearly as bad on a return visit as it was the first time. It was...loud, migraine-inducing dance music in the afternoon coupled with having  every friggin' door open, making it the coldest restaurant I've ever eaten at.

Then it became a Korean BBQ place I think (besides sushi, another restaurant concept that, you know, there's just so little of in the Richmond). No word on how cold it was then.

But I noticed at Belly Burger, it was chilly still. Is there some kind of ventilation problem here that they need to keep the doors open? That's what cost them the Yelp star in my review...

And be prepared to wait -- it ain't MacD's. It'll take 8-10 minutes to get you that order the way you like. Chill out (not a joke, but kinda yes, a joke) and think about what you'll want on your fries...
author: T C.

description:
The meat was nice and tasty. Fresh avocados and all the condiments on the side, scored big points to this burger fanatic. The only thing missing was beer, but I can go 15 minutes without a beer, I guess. Great place to get a burger. Try it now...

Now I need a beer.

No really Belly Burger hit the spot. I will return for another burger soon.
author: Eric B.

description: If your looking for a good burger with juicy meat, this isn't the place to go. There is something bland about the burger. The curly fries are great and so is the condiment bar though.
author: D S.

description: I had the cheeseburger. It was ok. They didn't ask (nor did I specify) the doneness of the patty, but mine came out pretty dry and overcooked (albeit still edible). Maybe if I had a standard medium I'd be able to bump this up a star. I liked the bun, which is on the airy side.
author: B Y.

description:
This is the unofficial vegetarian review of Belly Burger.

Sure, I only order one thing from there, (the veggie burger - pretend to be  shocked) but its pretty tasty! The veg-burger/bun is pretty decent standard fare but the toppings bar is what's the real attraction. I always like to load up mushrooms, lettuce, shredded carrots, alfalfa (or clover) sprouts, tomatoes, and cucumbers on my burger. What's great is there's even more herbivore-friendly toppings than that and they're all free to add on! If you're looking for meal diversity this may not be the place, but if you're looking for a quick veggie fix in the Richmond this place is worth checking out!
author: K H.

description:
I had no idea about the concept of this place.  I didn't know there were concepts to be had.  But apparently the "add your own toppings" is THIS place's concept.  One that I was unaware of when I ordered my burger "without onions" and got a strange look from my server.  She motioned to the salad bar looking counter to her right and said, "You just add your own toppings."

D'oh!

They have a good selection of toppings, but, I dunno.. do I really have to put it together myself?  I miss actually having my burgers put together FOR me.

What I REALLY liked about this place was the beef -- very good type of beef, not sure what kind, but tasty.  And also, their to-die-for onion rings... mmmmmm.  Tastes good drunk AND (as I suspect it will) sober.
author: Dianne d.

description:
As far as bang for your buck goes, I haven't found a better place in the Outer Richmond for a burger (this statement could apply to the whole of SF but there is a lot out there that I haven't tried).

Belly offers a lot of good options for your burger. I like to get the avocado burger with pepper jack cheese and add bacon or just order the standard cheese burger combo and make it up Fat Burger style with relish and the shedder lettuce. The great thing about this place is the options; they have all the fix'ns laid out in front of you. It is almost like being at a family BBQ. I start planning my burger or hot dog the second I walk in and it is really fun to think about all the options you can put together.

The support food is good too. Fries, onion rings, chili, and shakes all stand up to similar competition.

I also like the back patio. It is nice on sunny days and it kind of reminds me of a place I go to a bit back home.

In the right setting, I could see this place turning into a local chain or maybe even franchise.
author: Peter F.

description:
I love Belly Burger! The owner started recognizing me, so I don't even have to order anymore! He already knows! It's the greatest! 
The service is pretty quick. I only have a half-hour lunch, and waiting for my burger doesn't take that long. I haven't had an actual burger made of meat for more than a year, but I remember them being really great. Very fresh and cooked to order. the veggie burgers are very nice-- not homemade or anything, but the toppings bar makes them special. For once I get as many onions as I want! And pineapple! 
The fries are delicious, too. The atmosphere is peaceful. There is a little secret yard in the back if you like eating outside, and if not, there is a TV usually tuned to some kind of sports game, but not loud. This is a family business and I've never had bad service from anyone working there-- if it's not the owner, it's one of his kids or his kids' friends working, and they do just fine. 
As for price, a cheesburger with fries and a drink is $10.31 as of this writing. That is a fine price for a lunch out, hardly more than Subway. The only thing I can think of that I would change is more interesting decor-- a funky mural or something? But that hardly matters when you get such a good burger.
author: Red C.

description: This is a great ma and pop place for some comfort food.  My burger was put on the grill right after I ordered, no heat lamp burgers here!  The beef is also local, there's a little sign on the wall that says where it's from.  That's a nice touch.  The buns are so fresh and don't get in the way of the burger.  I also had a big portion of garlic fries, which were soo good.  I'll just have to grab a mint before kissing anyone.  There's a little "toppings buffet" where you can decide what and how much to put on your burger.  This is perfect for me, I'm kinda picky.  I was also there when they got the results of their health inspection.  Full marks!  They were obviously very proud.  It's nice to know you're eating in one of the cleanest places in the city.  Now I'm really craving a burger.
author: Kate N.

description:
Thank God someone finally put a good burger place on Geary. I mean across the street is an entire row of Sushi places. I need some variety man! 

The thing about Belly Burger is that it's OK, but because there's really not much like it around there, it's awesome. The place is pretty much no frills and usually pretty quiet. They've got the whole gambit of burgers, fries, dogs, shakes, etc. All of them are tasty, but not mind bending or anything. I do enjoy getting a burger with chili on it, that's just a ridiculous idea I can't get enough of. In fact you can get chili on anything in this place. I need to convince them to invent a chili shake, just to round out the meal. 

I'm glad it's there, and hell, it beats the hell out of Arby's
author: Andy A.

description:
It's actually a pretty good burger to go in your belly. And very reasonable prices. Since Belly advertises "all you can add" toppings for their burgers, seems like a lot of homeless take advantage: the guy next to me ordered a mini burger for $3.50, then heaped on a mountain of lettuce, tomatoes, and onions. Good for him!

It's too bad the interior feels so fast-food-esque, though, because this could have been a cool diner-style joint for the neighborhood.
author: Patrick G.

description:
Kate and I decided to forego our old burger stand bys: Bills, and In 'n Out and try Belly Burger since we are pretty darn close to it. In the end it just doesn't stand up to either one. The shake was okay. The burger was too salty by far, and I didn't get the feeling the fries were made in house.  As for the option of organic, grassfed meat, I went for it on my burger and well, the salt made it impossible to tell if it was better. As for the condiment bar, I think Wendy's has almost as many choices. 

Sorry, this one goes on Kate's and my "not need to go back there unless all the burger places in San Francisco magically disappear." I guess if I was Michael Bauer, I'd go back for a second try. I'm not though :()
author: Dennis S.

description:
So this is actually a 3.5 stars but since Yelp does not let you give half grades it will have to just look like I gave this place 3.

Belly Burger is the place to get yourself an above average burger at a reasonable price. Your burger is cooked over an open flame to a medium-rare perfection (note: if this is not your personal version of perfection I don't understand but they will, cook your burger how you like it cooked). The burger is big, not I just ate an entire cow head big, but big enough. I opted for an avocado cheeseburger and couldn't keep my knees from bucklin' when they put a whole half of the freshest sliced cali avo right on top!

After you get your burger comes the real special part: the burger fixings/I want a salad on top of my burger bar. I decided that some lettuce, sprouts and red onion with whole grain mustard was the perfect topping to my burger but you could be much more adventurous. The choices include kidney and garbanzo beans, peppers, carrots etc.

The fries and the other sides we sampled were ok, maybe too thickly cut for my taste. The burger really was the thing I will remember but the service and warm hospitality offered by the couple who owned the place should be noted as well.

If you are in the neighborhood, or on your way to Baker Beach, why not give this place a try?
author: Galen M.

description:
average burger joint with average service, priced kind of high for what it is, the novelty of building your own wears off quickly with wilted condiments or too thinly sliced maters.  Asked for medium rare, i got medium burnt, and my brother got rare. 

HUH?  ok, either fix your grill or there was something seriously wrong in that kitchen, as for the chili fries, meh, i've had better, decent fries but the chili is right out of a can from Kirklands.  

Also why go with a standard bun? HELLO this is SF, why not go with a sourdough bun?  anyways, i just expected better. I may come back in a few months and give it another shot. but hey at least this place is much better than Buffalo burger.
author: Cooper M.

description:
This is the type of place where I actually like their food... and they're located no more than a block away from my apartment... but there's just something missing that makes me want to choose Belly's over, let's say, Gordo. 

Yes, I realize they serve completely different types of food. But both are "go-to" types of eating establishments and one is winning out over the other.

They have some great combination deals. You can get a hearty burger, fries and a large soda for $6.95. Outside of BK-Have-It-Your-Way, you won't find something as fair-priced. Today's special included a salmon burger which I was quite curious about... but those Chic-Fil-A commercials made me want to seek revenge on cows so I went for a beefy burger instead. 

The condiments bar is their prized possession. They have jalapenos, pineapple slices, two different types of lettuce and many other enticing goodies. The spicy mustard is also a great option; I love places that provide diversity in mustards. 

The minor set backs are the lack of free refills (who does that any more?) and the decor doesn't feel right. Maybe if the place was larger and had booths I would think "yeah, this is cool" but the set up doesn't make me want to stay and hang out long.

But if you do like the digs and decide to stay awhile, they apparently have free wi-fi. Tap that.
author: Jared S.

description:
I can't believe anyone would think this is a good burger.  It actually tasted like one of those frozen Safeway hockey pucks.  Oh yeah, it was burnt too.

There are a lot of good burger joints in this town, this is not one of them.
author: Tony B.

description:
People...People I read some of the reviews and Damn....how well do you know this hood. 

The options are few and far between  for old fashioned stick to your stomach grub.  Unless you want SUSHI (which I love but now with one on every block I'm bored.) 

 Point is not many options unless you go to  Bill's or VIDEO cafe.. Now I've been going to Bill's place since I was seriously a Baby. However it got ruined a couple of years ago when roaches start crawling on to the counter!!!!!  Ever since I'm super careful. 

It better be 4am and I better be drunk to go to VIDEO lol
 S0 the point is Belly Burger is SUPER clean I just ate there this afternoon.  The tables were sparkly and had a reflection in them
 I have had takeout several times and service was polite and quick.........I am always down for a CLEAN, FAMILY STYLE SPOT!!  

PS if 8 or 9 bucks is too much for Burger/Fries and a soda (Taxes) not sure where you been going if it's not processed fast food.  


Ciao
author: Mariam Z.

description:
Now that I live in the Richmond District, I throughly enjoy the fact that I have a variety of international culinary options just steps from my door. However, the other night I was craving a good old fashioned hamburger and thought it was about time I tried this place. 

The concept is good they cook the burger and you decorate with your choice of many many toppings. I ordered the BBQ Cheeseburger. It was okay, not bad, not good just okay. My hamburger craving was satisfied and while I liked being able to build my own burger, I was not satisfied The meat was kind of bland, I could have make a tastier burger at home. 

I liked the fact that they had pineapple on the condiment bar. However, I was disappointed to see that the lettuce wasn't very fresh. The fries were tasty and I appreciated the free refills on the soda.
author: Marissa P.

description:
I had walked past this place several times, but had always kinda thought the place looked a little strange. 

Well, on a hungover Saturday, I was in need of grease!!! So I waked into Belly burger. 

First they serve Niman Ranch Angus beef which is a great beef and you have the option of upgrading to KOBE beef if you want or 1.75. 

I got the belly burger combo... cheese burger/gr onions/bacon. 
Fries and a drink. 11 bucks.... NOT BAD!!!! 

BIG MENU with lots of burger options.
author: Zac G.

description:
A few months ago, I wrote:
"The food is not bad. The service could be better."

Now, I have to say that they have turned me around. I dont' go as often, but when I do go, I feel a lot better. The guy at the counter is always nice and courteous and he already knows I do not like "coke with ice" I dont need to say "no ice, please".

The food has gotten better and the big tv screen is certainly a plus when the games are on.

Cheers!
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Oh Belly Burgers. The place just opened up a few months ago and I'm a loyal fan and avid customer already so must defend the last few reviews. I myself am quite the burger aficionado and cheap food foodie. 

The burgers are AMAZING and cooked just the way I like it (medium) everytime over volcanic rocks. I think that in and of itself is enough to make this burger joint the coolest. My favorite is the avocado burger with American cheese (Swiss is gross dude). The buns come toasted with butter and the beef is juicy, flavorful and ginormous. For less than $10, I get a huge Arnold Palmer (half lemonade, half ice tea), golden fries and the avo-burger. I highly recommend adding the sauteed mushrooms-- the ten minute wait is worth the wait. 

Have tried other items on the menu but can't comment much for the salads. The chili cheese fries are HUGE and must be shared with 3+ persons or you may go home feeling guilty/fat. 

The milk shakes (chocolate is my favorite) are made with real, all natural Breyer's icecream. Incredibly thick (must ask for spoon) and in my personal opinion, is also worth the wait. 

Note to self, Belly's is not a fast food joint to be confused with Sliders or McDonalds... it's a family owned, burger aficionado's restaurant and good things are... yes my friends, worth the wait. 

I'm a big fan of any place family owned (yay for entrepreneurship, no points for globalization) and have spoken to the owner on many occasions, most likely because the family is CHINESE, not Korean and have been able to speak to them while waiting for my avo-burg. The owner (in ref. to Nobu's Asian guy lookin' at you) is named Nelson. Talk to him about Yelp, he was pretty excited to get the good reviews.  I love kimchee and may ask about a kimchee burger hybrid for next year's menu. 

Moral of the review: great food, huge portions, well valued and worth the wait. 

=)
author: Festher C.

description:
I came here yesterday for the first time after wondering about it for so long. Anyway onto the review:

We got a #1 combo (hamburger, fries, coke) and a cheeseburger . The service was pretty good, the cashier was probably the owner from the looks of and and it seems like he works hard.

The do it yourself/self serve bar for toppings was what got me. I piled up lots of lettuce, tomatoes, and onions. The toppings were very fresh and plentiful. 

The beef patty was pretty burnt and charred. It looked like it was pre-cooked and then heated up again on the grill. Maybe Im wrong. I checked both burgers and they were made exactly the same, both overcooked/burnt! 

On top of that, we didnt even get natural beef. Natural beef is an extra $.75. That is such a bad idea. Why would you post a sign stating that natural beef will cost extra? It makes customers like me who get the normal beef feel like Im eating crap. 

The fries were better than Mcdonalds/BK/fastfood default fries though. They put weird nacho cheese type sauce on "cheese fries" so beware.

Prices were okay but overall it was disappointing. The burger wasn't hot as I expected and it was overcooked or cooked again after it was sitting around. I love the do it yourself toppings but I don't think it would save the patty if it tastes like charcoal.

I'll be back to see if they still burn their burgers.
author: SF N.

description: Gave this place a try ... they make an ok burger and fries but there is not much point going here again when Bill's is practically around the corner.
author: Julienne G.

description:
What used to be here? A Chinese take-out place? Anyway, it's now a Sliders-esque burger place where you can choose your own toppings. Let's do a happy dance just for the fact it isn't a sushi bar.

It's not the best burger ever. It's kinda flat and medium well, which suits Steve just fine, but I prefer a juicier medium rare. The fries were better than Bill's, though, and with the combo it friggin' fills up half the tray!

I'd probably go again and ask for a medium rare and see what happens. I see potential for improvement.

UPDATE: the grilled ham and cheese is awesome and some kind of genius because the buttery grilled part is on the inside so your hands don't get greasy.

The Italian Chicken sandwich was incredibly generously stuffed, but there's something spongy, Tyson-esque about the meat, so I doubt I'd ever order it again.

The buffalo wings tasted kinda off. Another one I won't repeat.

Still better than the Arby's that was here.
author: Stacy J.

description:
Four stars for Belly? I'm sorry folks. This is just ridiculous. This is what's wrong with Yelp. There's those of you that are just too nice and give everyone and they mama 4 or 5 stars. Fair enough nice guy, but you're screwing up the rating system. Then there are those who think good burgers come on 99 cent value menus, and to them Belly is top notch. 

To sum my experience at Belly, there's nothing special about the joint. The mushroom burger I had was decent. You can't really mess up a mushroom cheeseburger, but you can make it lip-smacking-foodgasmic-good. No foodgasm at Belly. Maybe it would help if you toast the bun? What really turned me off was the wilted lettuce that was getting that ill shade of brown at the condiment bar. Sorry folks, there's nothing four stars about that.
author: Al L.

description:
This is just a great place to get a burger.  Very reasonable price, especially when you consider the burger is as big as a newborn child.  I could hardly finish it and I love me some burger.  The condiment bar?  Holy mother.  I had a pineapple jalapeno addition to my Belly Burger (bacon, mushrooms, cheese, onions) and I was in heaven.  Most places would have named that combo something and I'd have had to pay extra.  Not at Belly!  Pile your burger to the roof with stuff, free O charge.  

I can't imagine they can stay this liberal with the food quantities for too much longer, but I hope they do!  

Oh, the bacon was cooked really well.  That's not often the case so thumbs up.  The fries are really good too.  Add to it that the place is not yet busy and we have us a winner in the Richmond.  So glad... Billy Burger needed some competition out here (Billy Burger = good variety and good taste, but high cost and teeny portions... not so bueno).  No more Billy Burger for me... I'm fill'n my burger cravings at Belly!!
author: Dan M.

description:
This ones right around the corner from where I live, so I had to try it one evening I was too lazy to cook.

The burgers are wonderful and they have pretty good and fresh stuff at the condiment bar.  The fries are very zen and tasty.  Onion rings are great.

I didn't have the best luck with the buffalo wings but I highly recommend coming in for a burger and fries or onion rings.
author: Theron L.

description:
Belly Burger deserves 3.75 stars.  My boyfriend and I walk into Belly Burger and didn't see anyone at the counter to take our order.  As we walk to the empty cash register, a girl comes out of almost nowhere and greets us.  (I think she was reading at one of the side tables during her downtime.)  The menu offers hamburgers with cheese, bacon, mushrooms, avocados and the Belly Burger is one with the works!  I settle for a cheese burger with jack cheese and mushrooms (yum, jack cheese!) and french fries and onion rings.  

The decor is not much to speak of, but wasn't expecting much from a small burger joint.  There is a wall full of '50's inspired tin posters advertising coca cola, ketchup, home cooking and the like.  A tv is on on the opposite wall and it's turned onto a game show.

Ten minutes pass and we're presented with our burgers.  We're advised to put all the toppings we want on them from the condiments bar.  The bar had everything-- iceberg and green leaf lettuce, red and yellow onions, jalapenos, relish, pickles, sprouts and kidney beans (yes, kidney beans...in case someone wants a kidney bean on their burger?!) and a few others.  

The moment of truth--a decent burger!  The mushrooms, cheese, and the toppings from the bar were on point.  The beef was tasty, but I realized they didn't ask how I wanted it cooked and it was a bit rarer than I prefer it (I like it medium well).  Wonder if I should have paid the extra $0.75 for the angus beef.  The bun wasn't anything special, and would probably benefit from a nice toasting.  

I'll go again cause there's so many different burgers you can come away with.  Maybe I'll request the bun toasted and ask for the angus beef medium well.
author: Marie B.

description:
The food is probably the only reason to come here for...the burger's are 7oz of Angus beef grilled to order...so if you order it, prepare for a 5-7 wait for your order. The best thing is the fries...they are thick and plenty of it.

The prices are reasonable. The decor is reminiscent of old time diners. The service is friendly.  I love the all you can pile on condiments...I never tried pineapples with my burger ^_^

**UPDATE: they've added sweet potato fries...they cut them in round circles, not crinkle cut either...taste is all right..needs some seasoning though.
author: Pauline L.

description:
It's nice to have a new burger option in the Richmond, cos there seems to be a lack of good ones in the 'hood! I'd say Belly Burger is my current neighboorhood favorite.

We almost always choose the "Natural Beef" option for 75 more, which essentially naturally fed Angus beef without hormones or antibiotics. Worth the upgrade, if you ask me!

I have so far never been asked how I want my burger cooked, but they seem to do a good job.

The condiment bar seems very well maintained. The veggies never look tired, they're always fresh.

Although this place is conducive to eating in (or in their kinda sparse patio/garden in the back), they make it easy for you to take your order to go. I've called ahead on occasion and they've had my burgers ready for me when I come in, ready for me to add condiments, and they'll wrap it up real quick-like for me so I can be on my merry way. It also helps that the staff has always been very friendly to us.

Their fries are a great complement to the burger, nice and crispy. Although, I think I personally prefer the fries at Buffalo Burger (up the street near 17th Ave.) that are of a thicker cut.
author: Courtney P.

description:
I was browsing yelp for another decent burger place.I read some reviews and thought to give this place a try.We got take out.However,there is a parking lot to the left of Belly Burger,but I think it would proably be packed during certain hours.The menu offers many options and the place reminds me of Sliders.

I got a Cheeseburger.Yep,just that and no fries.Let me tell you this burger was tasty,juicy and somewhat thick.It was perfect and well considering I was hungry at the time.I would say come here and try it out.The menu offers plenty of options:Veggie Burger,Italian Chicken Sandwhich,Grilled Ham & Cheese,Hot Dogs,Combo Meals and sides.

I enjoyed  Belly Burger and I would go back to taste more of what is on the menu.

Tasty.
author: Dani D.

description:
I just finished my monster burger and fries from this place.  I was sent out on a hunt for a burger, but the old faithful Buffalo Burger is still closed for remodeling.  Instead of driving all the way to the Haight or 9th & Irving as requested by my master, I remembered this place.  It's always got people going in and out when I pass by it, so I thought it would be safe, but I didn't know it was going to replace Buffalo Burger!

It's closer to home, they have fresh ingredients you add yourself (kind of a pain in the ass, but I got to put mushrooms and bell peppers on my burger so I could feel better about eating it!), and it's pretty cheap.  I fed both of us for only $13!  Wow, that bag o' fries sure is huge. . .
author: Godzilla T.

description: I really like the burgers here. The only thing I would suggest would be  little better way to keep the veggies. I usually get a bacon cheeseburger with the kobe beef. Muy tasty. Great after a few drinks at the blarney stone with your friends... ESPECIALLY after the giants win the pennant ;)
author: Marie C.

description:
I almost wish I hadn't stopped in because I've been trying not to have fast food-esque food these days, but couldn't resist.

I'm a simple hamburger, lettuce, ketchup & mustard girl so having a full burger bar at my disposal isn't a big deal, but I was amused by the variety. They mean it when they say you can put a lot on there- I saw some beans, sprouts, etc. For about 7 bucks you can get a big burger, fries, and a 24 ounce fountain drink- a steal considering what you get.

The only bad thing about the whole experience would be the two weirdos who came in, ordered to go, and shouted loudly at the flatscreen TV while the football game is playing. The TV is a plus if you're a sports fan but I imagine that having it there on a game day can be a minus if, like me, you prefer pigskins to remain on pigs whenever possible.
author: Rachael E.

description: Great hamburgers, great price but the condiment bar wasn't stocked. We should've asked to restock but we were in a hurry to go.
author: Brandon Y.

description:
They cook it, you decorate it.  Solid burger joint but nothing special.  It's small and looks family run and the service, even if not spectacular, is consistent and friendly enough.

If there's a game on TV, they're playing it on the flat screen.  Lots of college-type guys come in and make themselves at home in the booths.

If I'm craving a burger, this does the trick.
author: Melissa Q.

description:
I thought Belly's Burger was pretty good.  This is what I am looking for in a burger more than Bill's Place.  I know Bill's Place has been around forever but I just feel like the Belly's patty was more tightly packed and the meat not as loose like Bill's does it and the "meaty" taste of Belly's is more what I personally look for.  

So though Bill's Place, a couple blocks away, has been there forever and is a neighborhood icon and some may even consider a San Francisco institution, I think I would rather come here to get my burger and fry fix........

7 Oz Patties cooked to medium-well are what you get and over 18 toppings to choose from in their condiment bar.....

$4.85 buys you a cheesburger and if you elect for the Combo Meal (CB, Fries and Drink), the damage will be $7.45
author: Mark W.

description:
I've had the burgers and the buffalo wings.  The burger was pretty tasty, grilled, not fried, but the buffalo wings were only okay.

This place used to be a strange asian food restaurant, and before that an Arby's.  The only thing I miss are the seasoned curly fried.

This restaurant suffers from the problem of much of SF. It's always late when I'm in the mood for a burger and this place doesn't stay open long enough.
author: James D.

description:
I work less than a block away so when I have my burger urges, I go to Belly.  The owner is super nice and works hard.  He makes my burger just the way I like it, a little pink in the middle.  The condiment bar which includes anything and everything you would want on your burger.  Its amazing and fun to top your burger off with sprouts, onions, lettuce, relish, and cucumbers, and there are plenty of other tops you can try.  The chili was good, love the melted cheese on top!

The place the clean and neat, so I feel comfortable about getting food there.  I still have to try the wings which sounds delicious!
author: Wendy K.

description:
I'm a firm believer in rating restaurants within their category.  This is a fast-food type burger joint, and as far as fast-food burger joints go, it's a darn good one. 

Don't come here expecting a gourmet, blow-your-mind burger.  That's not Belly's style.  But you can expect to get a decently thick patty that's waaay better than stopping in at McDonald's.   I have no complaints about the quality of the food or the service.  Decent stuff.

I wasn't thrilled with the idea of grabbing my burger with the same hands I used to touch the self-service toppings utensils that other people had been touching all day.  Somebody could sneeze into their hand and then decide they want some more tomato.  :P

Anyway, maybe this is slightly OCD, but I asked for the bathroom key so I could wash my hands before eating.  Ladies know that restaurant bathrooms can sometimes be pretty scary, but I was pleasantly surprised at how clean Belly Burger is.  It was a very clean and inviting bathroom.  I don't know how many people choose a place to eat based on the cleanliness of its restrooms, but I'm just throwing it out there. It was clean. I was glad.  

I will come here for a burger again.
author: Megan Y.

description: Great Mom & Pop burger spot!  I even accidentally overpaid & the cashier was nice enough to let me know. Definitely worth a try.
author: Shawn R.

description: Had a cheeseburger here today. Service was good, burger was good.  Priced a bit high.
author: Scott K.

description: As good as the hamburger is the turkey burger is even better.  I'm not some kind of health freak either - it's just that good.  They cook it on an open flame and it gets this awesome little crusty bits that encapsulate all the smokey flavor from the grill.  Only downside is that they were out of turkey the last time I went there.  Also, the toppings bar is open - you can add 10 tomatoes and 100 pickles if you want.  Go here.  Now.
author: Charles W.

description:
Belly Burger is the place for a good old fashioned burger. Good old fashioned burger with your own choice of veggie toppings: tomatoes, jalopenos, alfalfa sprouts, onions, pickles, iceberg lettuce, romaine lettuce. It's like getting a subway sandwich, but for burgers. They also have hot dog options. I got the mini burger, which is essentially the size of the fast food burgers (which is plenty for me), but leads to me be curious about just how big the regular burgers are. The mini burger was $3.50 and was a good portion size. My honey got the hot dog combo (so with fries and a drink). The fries were pretty good - nice and crunchy. Ooh, kudos for toasting the buns (both on the burgers and the hot dog).

This is by no means a gourmet burger joint or anything like that - but if you are in search for a sturdy old fashioned burger, this is the place to go.
author: Annie Y.

description:
I went to Belly Burger based on nobu k's review. It was so funny that I had to experience the place for myself. Now my belly is full and I have a smile on my face.

I'm not a big hamburger eater, but I will be with Belly Burger in my neighborhood. The burgers are just short of 1/2 a pound. The mini burger is 1/4 pound! I had the bacon cheeseburger, and the bacon was cooked just right. I rarely find that to be the case with bacon on a burger.

Belly Burger has a full topping bar so you can dress your burger up how you want it. The place is exceedingly clean, and the food is just pristine. Check out Belly Burger. You won't regret it!
author: David H.

description: Essentially a Subway for burgers.  Decently priced, but nothing special for a burger.
author: Joe G.

description: Cheeseburger was good. I really like the soft old fashioned bun. But my girlfriend was not as impressed with her bland turkey burger.
author: C t.

description:
I'd say average style and tasting burgers. What with the gourmet burger craze up and rising I thought this would be just that kind of place. Semi-wrong.

They have this weird vegetable bar for burger decorations.... SOmething I just don't like about moist soggy vegetables waiting for me to pick them. 

But overall? Not fancy enough for my expectations or even the price (but not expensive, like 5.95 for an avo burg). It almost tasted like a burger you make yourself on a bbq therefore no better and more expensive than doing it myself. 

The guy was nice, though. And it was all fresh!

I wouldn't recommend it to anyone but if someone wanted to go there, I wouldn't turn them down?
author: Sydney T.

description: Priced super fair, especially considering it's Niman Ranch. We didn't get fries or a drink, and the bill for two came out to under ten bucks. You pick your own toppings from a freaking buffet table of toppings, including pineapple. There's not one thing wrong about this place. Going back all the time!
author: Josephine L.

description: Weird name, good burgers. My fries and burger were cooked fresh and the topping bar is awesome.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Second time here the other day.
Good burger. 
Good toasted bun.
pre-cooked bacon on the "Belly Burger"...
...and not even good bacon...
The "Belly Burger" is your signature burger.
Why NOT cook the bacon, mushrooms, and onions to order?
Especially if its 3pm on a weekday?
Ordered clam chowder....
Tasted like watered down Progresso chowder mixed with watered
down Progresso cream of mushroom.  Do not order.
I am a onion ring freak.
Ordered those....
SLAMMIN!
Every district needs at least a couple decent burger joints.
This one is good enough for repeat visits.
They even let us get our burger on with a twelver of brews sitting on 
the table next to us.  Isn't that worth another star?
author: Barry A.

description:
I had been a little curious about this place while walking by a few weeks ago.  Wondering if this place would suffer the same place as the (disastrously) short lived tenants after Arby's (wasn't it a Hawaiian BBQ for about an hour?).  
Saw that it was actually Yelped decently (thanks guys) and I'm going to have to agree with those who liked it.  Pretty straightforward, really.  I had a bacon burger (hey... don't look at me like that) and fries.  First of all... you better be HUNGRY.  The burgers are good sized, nice soft bun, juicy burger, crispy lettuce.  Seemed fresh and good.  Nice thick cut fries, too.  I would stop by this place before I would ever go back to Bill's place again.

Update: Went again for lunch on a weekday.  Not much of a crowd, but still good.  Tried the grilled chicken sandwich this time.  Not overcooked or dry.  Just right.  Score!
author: Jason M.

description:
Four of us came over from work and the service was pretty fast. It's nice having a patio out back to hang out when there is sun in the Richmond District.  

One of us had a burger, another had a veggie burger, one had a salad & I had the chilli. All in all, I'd say it's just OK. No crackers with Chilli? No bread with Chilli? You have to buy Chips to go with the Chilli!
author: M M.

description: Food was great and served quickly, I was filled with the portion size and the fries were so fresh. I didn't give it 5 stars because the service wasn't that great. They could definitely be much more friendlier.
author: Jay R.

description: LOVE the veggie and condiment bar.  Now I can load up my burger with as many alfalfa sprouts and pineapple slices as my heart desires at no extra cost!
author: Jenn C.

description: One of my favorite burger joints in S.F.!  My wife and I always split a combo Belly burger with fries, grilled onions, shrooms, your choice of cheese and a large soda for around 10 bucks!  We belly up to the toppings counter and load up on the tomatoes, lettuce, and pinapple and when I want to keep her up at night, chili peppers!  We try to control the quantity that we eat and when you do that the food you eat has to be really tasty and satisfying.   The burger cooked to order over the fire pit is  slightly larger than bun and looks well dressed and delectable after we slather it in the "all you can fit on" toppings. Eat it slow because you want to enjoy every bite!
author: Curtis L.

description: The food was just okay. I got an avocado burger and I kind of wish I had added cheese. The Dijon mustard gave the burger a good kick, but it tasted like a burger I could make at home (for cheaper too). The top bun also seemed greasy for no apparent reason. The place is clean and the service was good, but I'd rather trek it to an In n Out.  Service was really good though and they were helpful in explaining what to do in case you were lost.
author: k h.

description: The staff was super friendly and accomodating, but the food wasn't that great.  I was hopeful when I saw the sign about the nieman ranch burgers, but so disappointed when the food came out.  The burgers were frozen patties and over done.  For the price, I'd rather go to Darla's in the sunset.
author: michelle D.

description: The start was a little shaky. We went in a little before close on Sat night. I try not to do this because, lets face it, no one likes to see three people stumble in the door 20 min before you get to go home. He was very gracious and the bacon cheeseburger i orderded was hot and very tasty. I'm not surprised that the condiment bar was a little low so no complaints here. One more shoutout to bacon. Can i get a high-five for bacon!! Belly did it right and i'm not much for burger places but this one is a winner
author: Greg H.

description: The burgers here are pretty good. I got a bacon cheeseburger here awhile back I believe and it was so good! The chili cheese fries here are also good as well. It takes awhile for them to make it, but it's worth it. I like the decor also. Very modern.
author: Vivian L.

description: enjoyed it. just looked it up on yelp after a trip to Golden Gate park and it was right around the corner. great burgers and service. classic burger joint with angus beef or kobe for an extra $1.75. the only qualm i had about it was that i'm not a big self-serve person and i had to put my own topping on the burger. not a big deal, but whatever. just my personal preference. also, management apparently has no problem with people walking around without shoes. but hey, it's san francisco... lol just freaked me out to see that going on at the salad bar.
author: Getti G.

description: This place is alright. Service is a bit gruff, but quick. They cook the burgers on this weird pyramid shaped grill. I like that the kitchen is open so you can see what they're doing. And the self-serve condiments section is a really nice touch. The veggies are cut well and are usually pretty fresh. But I dunno. The burgers are just really average. It taste like they just throw some meat on a grill, slap on a slice of cheese and that's it. It's not terrible but you feel like you could make something just as good at home.
author: Eli H.

description: Organic burgers.  Vegetable garden buffet.  Service with a smile.  What more could I ask for?  Whenever I need a well prepared burger, I visit this joint.  Compliments to the chef.  My only gripe with them is that they're not open late.  I'd like to give them 4/5 stars for that, but on product and service, they deserve nothing less than 5 stars.
author: David M.

description: Well belly burger I really really want to love you, but you kind of make it hard sometimes. First off the people that work here are super nice all the time which is a plus, and they have a great condiment bar that's very well stocked to say the least, white and red onions, two types of lettuce, olives, pineapple and a bunch if other stuff which is different from any other burger place I've been to. So the bad part is I think that they're kind of overpriced for the burger/setting and the extras are over priced for sure $1 for gilled onions. Also sometimes the burgers are over cooked (which to me is an ultimate burger sin) I want my burger juicy not crispy :( also I kind of have "beef" with there sweet potato "fries" I use that word lightly because they're more of fried slices of sweet potato and when cut like that they just don't taste right. There regular fires are okay but I think they might be frozen. All in all not a bad place but unfortunately just not reliable for a properly cooked burger.
author: Dominique D.

description: Tasty, actually grill-flavored Niman Ranch beef for less money. Cons are the ambiance (typical fast food...but too dimly lit at night). Pros - tasty, freshly cooked to order, and lots of toppings to add. Curly fries were good. The batter on the calamari was very light and crispy, though not the best calamari I've had. Like the choice of chicken and other seafood too, but will try another time.
author: Gale H.

description:
I'd give it 3.5 .5 for the refill. 
.. I noticed I still haven't received my garlic fries.. 
all, I've gotten was regular fries and regular fries with pepper. 
Bf ordered a mushroom burger while I got my brother a bacon burger. 
The burger was fat and juicy the way we like it, I ate half of the mushroom burger but I don't agree with mushrooms 'cause they hate me.
