But lately it's hard to find a burger that satisfies me.. it has that asian taste (: But they also serve kobe burgers.. I have no idea what it means.. but I goggled it.. giving me japanese burgers .. and my bf explained that the cows are served wine and massage.. damn, I wish I was one of those cows right now.. living it up in Japan too!
Also, they make the burger you sauce it out! spice it out, and top it all off.. and at the end when you order to-go your box won't close so ask for a rubberband, it'd make things all better and you won't be standing at the counter stressed out on closing your box like me :(
author: Carolyn Y.

description: belly belly belly, burger, burger, burger.  belly belly belly, burger, burger, burger. With chili and cheese fries, BELLY, BELLY, BELLY, burger, burger, burger.
author: George S.

description: Belly Burger is legit. The bacon is thick and applied with a heavy hand, the burger has a char-grill taste, the price is CHEAP compared to most, especially Bill's not too far away on Clement. Where my bf and I can have a $40 bill for 2 greasy fall apart burgers and a couple of drinks. Plus, this place has a fresh topping bar of about 15 toppings for no extra cost to you. Get the garlic fries, a small is PLENTY, they're amazing. However, interior kinda sucks. Take your burger home if you live close, that's what we do!
author: Angie M.

description: When I need a nice fat juicy burger and need it soon, I go to this place. It's just  a couple blocks from where I live and well worth the little travel to get there and have one of their burger. They burgers are decent but I really like the fact that they allow you to put on the toppings yourself. They have a wide variety of toppings even pineapple and you can pack them on as fat or as little as you want!!!! Their fries are also very delicious too! although I wish they had bigger ketchup cups, I only ever seem to be able to get 4 or 5 fries with ketchup then I need to go get a new cup! AHHH Very reasonably priced for a nice little burger stand! If you're in the area and want a burger give Belly a shot! It will most def fill up your belly! The burgers are pretty large!
author: James H.

description: I love BELLYS! The chlli cheese fries are amazing! They dont hold back on the cheese or the chlli or the fries! and the milkshakes are yummy! 5stars
author: Vickie W.

description:
I came here looking for a basic burger, but something that stood out from the rest. Didn't want truffles or foie gras. Just a good burger. I read several good reviews on this place so I had to try it. 

One thing I always love about a"good burger joint" is that the ambiance is inviting and fun. Nothing special when I got here. No "Welcome to Belly's" when I came in. Maybe that's a southern thing. 

On to the burger because it seems that's what this place should be all about. I got the double cheeseburger and a small order of fries.
The size of the burger was great! The bun was off the grill, but didn't have butter, which I can live without. They have a condiment/fixins bar to dress up the burger yourself. I sat down to wait for my order, which was to go, and noticed the cheese options no where near the burger menu. Well, i'm out of luck, cause the burger is almost done. I guess i'm getting American, though if he would have asked what kind of cheese, I would have definitely asked for cheddar. I guess it's my fault for not reading the entire menu. When the burger was ready, they set it on the counter open faced so you can hit the condiments. They had some options you wouldn't find everywhere, but the leaf lettuce was the only thing that looked fresh. When done I went back to the counter where he packed everything up for me to take home.

The burger was ok. The main flavor was the char from cooking. The bun was cheap and fell apart from the juices before I ate half the burger. 

Basically, with a little seasoning and a good bun, this could be a better burger.

The fries were below average. 

I well definitely be continuing my search for a good burger joint in the Richmond.
author: Cory G.

description:
new burger places don't open very often, so i was more than willing to give this place a shot

since it opened only a little while ago, the place is still incredibly clean, so we can all wait for the grime to start building up. until then, feel free to eat off the floor. it's gleaming.

past that, the biggest letdown was that they don't make patty melts, which is an outrage. next, the shakes are on the small side. lastly, the wall benches are plywood nailed into the walls at 90 degree angles, so there's no comfort there at all.

still, those are negligible if the food is good, and it doesn't disappoint. service is prompt (if struggling to understand english) but understanding. the patties themselves are huge and juicy, and for only 75 cents more you can get "organic" meat. joy.

lastly, the onion rings are phenomenal, staying crunchy and giving way to your teeth, instead of being dragged out of the battered shell like most other places.

the giant flatscreen TV is great for watching games, but the otherwise clinical atmosphere doesn't prompt most to stay. take it to go and you'll be better off.
author: Charles C.

description:
i pass by Belly at least 5 times a week... but it took me 5 months to cut the snob act and get me some heart cloggers! everytime i walk by all i see are guys particularly teens and random men, and you know guys they eat about just anything (any maybe because there's a girl working the counter?.) 
Anyways... Belly isnt "fast" food but it isnt very diner like either..... and it's definitely no BARNEY Burger! i ordered the mushroom cheese burger and french fries... and waited... then this sign caught my eye "natural beef add .75" .. THEN WHAT THE FUDGE DID I GET??????? not only that i didnt get to choose my cheese for my UN-natural beef.... so i left with fries and a UN-natural burger with mushrooms, and american cheese:(... all for 8.25! i was disappointed. and a bit confused. 
 i ate my UN-natural burger (which wasnt half bad.) and contemplated my day. should i have asked to change my cheese, for tomatoes, onions, or pickles?.... maybe just maybe i didn't de$erve it to begin with since she did ask if i wanted ketchup. (one of the two things she did asked besides..."for here or to go") maybe i was suppose to do it myself..... if so... how was i suppose to know... darn my inability to be demanding! GIMME GIMME GIMME.... GIMME MORE!

all in all not bad... for on the go food. but not for the price.
author: Lynn T.

description:
Overall, Belly Burger ain't bad. I ordered the chicken sandwich with fries, and even though it did take a little while to make, it was pretty delicious. The fries were great, the piece of chicken was huge (so big that I had to cut off the excess with a knife). I did have a scare for second where I thought part of the chicken was under cooked, but it all turned out okay.

They do seem understaffed, however, hence the slow service. The place also reminds me a lot like Sliders, with the same plates and grill and, well, almost everything. They were nice enough to change the channel on their HDTV to the Giants game for us, which was awesome.

I'll try the Avocado Cheeseburger next time.
author: Alexis C.

description:
every so often i have a hankering for chili. on stuff.

like a chili dog, or chili cheeseburger.

up until this place, i couldnt find a descent place for such foodstuff.

yay for belly burger.

large servings on ginormous trays, and a huge tv for watching sports while consuming large amounts of chili. i feel so male here.
author: Darrell L.

description: SOOOOOO good.  I got the cheeseburger combo, and I was a little disappointed when I saw there was only a bun with cheese and meat.  Then I made my way over to the toppings bar, only to be overwhelmed by the amount of options.  The fries were awesome, and my boyfriend enjoyed watching the 49ers while we were there.  Mmmm I wish I had a belly burger right about now....
author: Courtney K.

description:
This is not a green pepper welfare burger, it's really good! Tastes like moms burger without the wonder bread. The O rings are bomb!!

They have a huge tv with cable.  I dont own a tv, so that makes this place even more special. Free cable + good eats = word!! :)
author: travis v.

description: This joint has a nice vibe, and as I was eating, I couldn't have been happier, but as I'm looking back on it, the food wasn't that great. Sure it's a step up from burgerking and places like that. There just wasn't that pizazz I'd expect from a place named "belly burger".
author: Nichole H.

description:
This is a really fine, no nonsense kinda burger joint. When it opened up around the corner from my house, I decided it was worth making an effort to support it, especially given that the other places nearby that have burgers are Bill's Place (overpriced and overrated), and the Rainbow 24 Hour Video Diner (the best place to be drunk and lonely at 3am) which serves the same frozen burgers we used to have on monthly cookout night at the YMCA summer camp. Attempting to lend my support to Belly, I went around the corner to another new place which bore the putrid smell of rapid and crushing eatery failure, took their Grand Opening banner since it wasn't helping anyway, and brought it over to Belly. However, the people who run the place are painfully kind (though reserved), and seemed uncomfortable with displaying a banner stolen from a block away. Fortunately, it seems that business has picked up of late, even without my generous support.

While it isn't really the serious foodie's shangri la, it's a prime choice for a delicious burger. The burger is real big and juicy (shout out to sir mix-a-lot)...my preferred prep is to get it cooked rare, with no salt on the patty or butter on the bun. don't worry, it'll still taste good and kill you a bit slower.  For $5.75 you really can't beat it. 

Over the last couple years the veggies have consistently improved. The condiments are also improving, although I'm still waiting for barbecue sauce- why burger joints have been able to get away with the more costly "Barbecue Burger" scam instead of including barbecue sauce with the condiments, I'll never know. The featured condiments are mayo, mustard, ketchup, tabasco, and red chili flakes. 

One drawback is the mediocrity of the wings and the fried chicken. I think this could be cleared up with a little work on the batter, and some subtlety with the sauce on wings. Overall though, this place is really good, and I'm glad it's a block from my home.
author: noah c.

description: Yummy!  I like my burgers medium well or well done, and mine was perfectly crisp and juicy.  I will have to return for another visit to sample the fries as the burger alone is a meal in itsetl.  The proprieter was friendly and the place was very tidy - Overall the experience is better than Bills.
author: Sue U.

description: First off let me mention the sweet potatoe fries they are amazing i could eat them as a meal my self. Second they have about four or five different vegetarian options which is an alright number for me. I also noticied that  the beef that they use for the burgers is local and the same beef (that barneys uses). However i dislike there milkshakes they use flaovered ice cream intead of syrup and vanilla. However this place is defiently worth the time to stop on by, and check it out.
author: Noelle L.

description: I'd have to agree with Jared. I really do like the food here, but there's something missing that makes it impossible for me to think "yea, let's hang out at Belly's!". That said, there's absolutely nothing wrong with their service or food. In fact, the food is great and the service is fine. But as I mentioned before, the place feels a bit dry and in need or something new/novel to get people coming in.
author: Simon L.

description:
I think this place is great! For the price point you TOTALLY get maximum bang for the buck! 

At $4.95 I get good quality beef in my cheeseburger. I have to add that the fact that they light toast the buttered buns is fantastic (great extra touch!)
Now, as for the toppings - this place is awesome. The coolness really comes in the attention to details: iceberg OR greenleaf lettuce, and then the onions - red OR white onions (plus, all the other great stuff like mushrooms, cucumbers, pickles, relish, etc)

Seriously, maybe I'm just a sucker for details - but the choice of lettuces and onions, as well as the lightly toasted buttered buns at the price of $4.95 (for a cheeseburger)....it's just freakin' awesome!

I see that people complained about the "fast food decor".....but hell, I think there decor is cute, basic and zippy. Again, it's a $5 burger joint....you're not going to get white table cloths for pete's sake! And frankly at the reasonable prices they're charging, I think the decor is great!
author: Detox B.

description:
the premiere dark horse burger joint in San Francisco.  pricewise its not too shabby, the service is decent, and the condiment bar is astonishing.  highly recommend the mushroom burger, but if you're feeling vanilla the Belly burger will do just fine.  

catch a sports game on their gigantic HD screen while you eat.
author: Jon H.

description:
skip the fries (sweet potato, chili cheese) 
the corn dog at $1.95 was worth every penny. the cornmeal was slightly sweet which balanced the savory hot dog it wrapped. i believe the cornmeal should ALWAYS have flavor on its own!!
The bacon cheeseburger... BF did not share. I blinked and it was gone. considering his diet consists of mainly meat and potatoes....i took it as it was better than good.
author: A L C.

description: Nice neighborhood environment. A secret tip: they have a nice plasma on the wall for PLAYOFF FOOTBALL! First time there, had the turkey burger and chilli cheese fries. To be honest, that was enough food for two! I loved the fact that I could add infinite sprouts and mushrooms after I got my burger. Strongly recommend if you are in the area! Very nice girl at the counter too.
author: Pat L.

description:
Solid burgers, and love the add-your-own-toppings, Fuddrucker's style. Clean place; nice cashier. Price is right; parking's a bitch.
Wish I lived closer, this would be one of my hangouts.
author: Matt G.

description:
I love Belly Burger! 

It looks like just a little ordinary burger joint but once you get the food, you are getting a level of quality that goes beyond the ordinary. You can get natural beef there, beef with none of the hormones, steroids and antibiotics found in most ground beef. And it tastes amazing. The burgers are cooked on some kind of volcanic rock that gives them a delicious outdoor grilled taste. The fries are perfect. They're real potatoes, not frozen, and you can taste that. Two people can share one bag of fries, it's huge. The toppings bar is totally fresh with a great assortment of standard toppings and some you don't see anyplace else, like pineapple and jalapeno peppers. Tongs are provided for each item. I am addicted to pineapple, pickle, sprouts, lettuce and tomato on my burger and I will never get that exact combination any place else so they have my business for life....Water is free. That's all I've ever had but they do have an extensive menu with a lot of burger joint type stuff, fried chicken, fish and chips, hot dogs, a very well priced steak sandwich..lots of good choices, although I love the Natural Beef burger, which has a wonderful flavor. They also offer about 5 different cheeses to top your burger and you can also get griled onions, avocado and a number of other specialty toppings from the kitchen.

Parking is next door in a public lot and the 38 Geary bus stops right on the corner. They close at 10 pm. 

There's a flat screen TV, usually with a game on, sometimes the news or a kid friendly movie. There is also a small garden with a few tables out back so you can sit outside on a beautiful day. The place is super clean and family friendly and by family friendly I mean, the restroom is spotless and big enough for you and 2 kids and a dog.. If I'm having a burger in the Richmond, this is where I go. Prices are about the same as a fast food place, which amazes me because the quality of food at Belly Burger is so high. I mean, $4.65 for a hamburger! With the free toppings bar.  Make it 100% natural beef and we're looking at an astonishing $5.40.

**Update: Last time I was here I had the sweet potato fries which took the experience to a whole nother level. Belly Burger is the little burger joint that can!
author: Sharon J.

description: I've found Belly Burgers to be kind of hit-or-miss.  Today I ordered a number one combo (burger, fries, and a soda).  The fries were overdone (crunchy, but not in a good way).  They don't ask you how done you want your burger.  Mine was tasty but a bit too "well done" for my liking.  What I do like about this place is you can pick and choose your own toppings, the veggie toppings appear very fresh, and they give you plenty of fries.  One more negative thing...never, EVER order the cheese fries.  They take an order of fries and then drown it in that funky nacho cheese sauce you find at 7-11.  Yuck.
author: Peter F.

description: Burger was overcooked this time.  Poo, I really wanted to like this place.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
I had a grilled hot dog with cheese & grilled onions. The bun was buttered & toasted on the griddle....great move. The onions were cooked well...a pet peeve of mine & a request I made (for .85 extra, they should be done right....right?)
They were nice & the menu was varied enough...even a fried egg  or a steak as an option....also natural beef for extra if you want
The grill is just like sliders & mo's in north beach.
The decor is cheesy, but clean. My only regret...no philly cheesesteak!
author: neil a.

description:
Their hamburgers and fries are really good, and that's all I ever order.  They have several cheese options for the cheeseburger (American, Swiss, jack, pepper jack, etc.).

The first couple of times I went there, it was absolutely great.  But, later on, there were a couple of times when my food didn't taste quite as good and I noticed that this was when Belly Burger was busy.  Some people on here complain that their food takes a long time.  If you want your food in 2 minutes, go to McDonald's.  I would rather wait 5-10 minutes for good food than get instant crap (and a swift kick to the stomach, like Bill's place will give you).

After that, I avoided Belly when they were busy, so as not to get inferior food for my dollar.  But recently, I did go there when they were busy and the food was just as good as usual.

Belly Burger's burgers always taste fresh and delicious.  With Belly in the neighborhood, I don't need to suffer through another Bill's burger, where you don't know which bite will taste rotten, and the service sucks, and you pay $2-$3 more.

The only hamburger I like more than Belly's is the one at Pork Store Cafe on Haight, the mushroom burger.  I think I had a mushroom burger at Belly once, and the mushrooms were not very tasty.  But Belly Burger is definetely the best place I've been to in the Richmond (Bill's=questionable, Hamburger Haven=ok, Video Cafe=disgusting).  I haven't been to Buffalo Burger yet, but if it's the same as the one in West Portal, then I'm not missing much.  That place is horrible.

Mid-December 2007 update:
Ate at Belly a bunch of times lately.  Every single time, the burger was great.  And they've also been busier than I've ever seen them.  It looks like I'm not the only one willing to wait a few minutes for a GOOD burger with fresh ingredients.  I also recommend the avocado burger.

Early-September 2008 update:
Not sure if I've even been to Belly since last year.  Are they still there?  I guess I just got tired of Burgers.  Gordo has been decent lately.
author: Nick B.

description:
All burgers come with cheese, 6 kinds (choose) to be exact. Note the menu also says "All burgers are cooked medium unless special requested."

I had the "Belly Burger", most expensive on the menu. It was medium cooked, and not super juicy but I don't mind. 

All told, it took maybe 5-6 minutes for my to-go order to be prepared. The girl working the counter was very nice and friendly. She gave me my to-go burger box so that I could head to the bar area and pile on some more things. After finishing I handed it back and she packed it up for me along with the rafter hefty bag of side order fries I ordered as well.

http://img149.imageshack.us/img149/2573/bellaycg6.jpg
Picture of my "Belly Burger". See the mushrooms, onions, and bacon piled onto the sandwich. You can barely see the cheese. Bottom photo is me holding half the burger, with a big bite taken out of it.

5 stars for a satisfying $5.95 burger in the Outer-ish Richmond. Lots of meat, lots of fresh add-ons. I like, and will return.
author: Shan W.

description:
GREAT - delicious Burger that I never tried it before.  Cheeseburger was excellent, we can add all the toppings as you like, the fries was fat, perfection.  My friend also ordered a hot dog and fries, all delicious.  We like this nice place and great food.

One more thing, they are good price too.  just under $10 you can get really big burger, big portions of fries and refill soda.

Very ....very....good place to go.
author: Ada C.

description: Niiiiice burger here.  Similar to Fat Burger, but less money and better fries.  Being able to spec how done you want it and what toppings goes on is really cool.
author: John H.

description: The chili cheese fries are awesome! Since I am a french fries fanatic, I was on my quest to find good fries. Belly Burger is a very clean and nicely decorated place. The staff is friendly. Next time I'll try a mini burger and sit on their patio.
author: MS K.

description: They serve a good veggie burger, really good onion rings and the shakes are great! the toppings bar is full of odd but delicious vegetables... atmosphere is kind of cheezy and not too comfy, but for a cheap meal it does the job! the service was so-so....all in all, if you are in outer richmond, surrounded by asian cuisine, looking for a burger.... this is the place to be!!
author: Kaylan S.

description: Any place that thinks it's ok to put nacho cheese on fries does NOT get 4 or 5 stars under ANY circumstances.  The idea of the condiment bar is great but most of the fixin's were gone when we were there.  No dijon mustard either?  Chicken sandwich was ok.  Prices seem reasonable on some items and outrageous on others for no reason.  It tries.  It fails.
author: M M.

description: Burgers can be ok at this seemingly ripoff of Sliders. Had a few well done burgers after specifically requesting medium rare as well as american cheese when I specifically asked for swiss. Also was rebuked at a request to have chili added to my fries on the combo platter. Instead of making a customer happy and adding $2 bucks to the combo for the chili, the non friendly gal working there tried to charge me like $12 for the thing piece meal. I explained to her that it was ridiculous, but she would have nothing to do with my request. Guess what, I now walk an extra 3 blocks to Bills Place for my twice weekly burgers. Probably better for my waistline getting the exercise.
author: Hank S.

description:
This place have some pretty good burger at a decent price  ($4.75)...of course, I prefer even LOWER.  But you get what you pay for in McDonalds!  

I ordered a regular burger.  It was flame broiler to order.    The meat was good and the wide variety of condiments available.  My only complaint is that they didn't toast the bun.  It would've made it tasted a lot better.
author: Gary Y.

description:
great place to go if you live in the neighborhood and want a good burger and fries. 

The price is right and the burger is made on a circular grill not a hot plate - which adds flavor.

there is a fixin' bar with lettuce, pickles etc... the atmosphere is clean  -- it's great to pop in and have a quick bite.. especially beats a franchise.

Bills place is good too.. but always look greasy and a little dirty to me...
author: Jippers C.

description: They cook it, you add your own toppings to it.  Nice burger joint but nothing special.  It reminds me of sliders.
author: Russ B.

description: You want a run of the mill burger, that's cooked to order, here ya go. It really wasn't anything special, and the onion rings were just ok.  Kudos to having the stacked condiment bar, though, that's a plus.  If I were to go back, I'd try a shake, saw the girl making one, and dang did it look tasty.
author: Scott R.

description: Good place.  Nice to have a place in the neighborhood to get a burger and onion rings.  A little sterile, but now that I've read Nobu k.'s review, I'm beginning to appreciate that aspect.
author: Benjamin P.

description: This is a small, modest place--but with some good, juicy burgers--and if you pay a little more, you can get organic beef. No frills, just good eatin'...!
author: J K.

description: I get so gosh darned excited about CHEESEBURGERS!  Unfortunately nothing douses the flames of burger desire as much as nacho cheese sauce engulfing your crispy golden fries.  Alas, I brought said fries back to the counter and told the burger man they weren't what I was hoping for.  He knew right away I wanted shredded cheddar instead.  I got some regular fries in the end.  The burger was just OK.  Condiment bar was nice.  They still have some figuring out to do, nice idea though.  Try Custom Burger instead.
author: Matt P.

description:
I was a little sad to see the little Chinese takeout place that was here before Belly Burger opened go, but after coming back a few times, I'm more than pleased with the replacement.

The ambiance is not much to look at, but the burgers are delicious! Generous size, meaty, sufficiently juicy, and fresh. Nothing like the fast food fare, and they beat the nearby Bill's place hands down. I really like the condiment bar - a free run of all kinds of fresh veggies & addons with every burger. Yum!

The other fare is so-so. Service was always fast and friendly.

I'd give them 4 stars for this neighborhood, if not for the Buffalo Burgers just up Geary.
author: Sandra B.

description: I went here a month ago on my way home from work. i was craving for burger and I decided to check this place out. It's just like the other burger joint where you put your own toppings on. I took it To-Go. The Burger was actually really good and the staff was really nice also. I will go back here if I want a burger.
author: Ge I.

description: Belly Burger is great.  Delicious burgers, decent prices, nice family that work there, clean, an add your own toppings counter.  Goodbye (and good riddance) Arby's, welcome Belly.
author: Dee K.

description: Great Milkshakes, love the fries.. Does anyone know if there is a secret menu?
author: Russ R.

description: belly is good. i like the diy burger topping option. olives to jalapenos. good fries. tasty catsup.
author: aidan m.

description: I'm guessing that Belly is the slowpoke little sister of Slider's, by the circular grill and condiments bar. If someone told me that it was possible for service to be slower than Slider's, my jaw would drop in disbelief. Pick your jaws up, people: It's true. I waited no less than 15 minutes this afternoon for a chocolate milkshake. JUST a chocolate milkshake. Not malted, not extra large. Just regular. And I was the only person there. Surprisingly, no one seemed concerned that the shake had been in the shaker for about 10 minutes. Then the man was painfully slow about pouring all of my shake into a cup that only held half the contents of the shake can. He  tries to give me just the dinky cup and send me on my merry way. Umm...I didn't pay 5 dollars and sacrifice 15 minutes of my life that I will never be able to get back for a half cup of melted ice cream. That didn't just happen. I ask for the rest AND I ask again for the whipped cream I'd already asked for. The man looked shocked and amazed that anyone would make such an exotic request. We worked it out. But it was painful. And the shake just made me feel chubby. I'll go back and try the burger someday. Maybe.
author: Autumn K.

description: the wind blew me here, but 7OZ. of beef later, it didn't blow me out.
author: chris o.

description: Great burger.  Bad ambiance.  Toppings bar is a nice touch but looks a bit sketchy.  Backyard patio may be best feature.
author: T R.

description: After mailing some stuff at the post office a few weeks ago and getting fed up with waiting for the Ocean Beach 38, I stopped by this place. What can I say? I was intrigued. I've lived in this neighborhood all my life and Belly Burger (after Arby's and that NASTY Asian restaurant) was the only incarnation of this place I ever considered setting foot in and actually trying the food. Plus, I was in the mood for a burger. I got a bacon avocado cheeseburger. It was DAMN good. And not very expensive. I didn't get any fries but from the sounds of the reviews, I should have. The woman at the counter was really nice. The service was a bit slow, but there were quite a few people in there so I was ok with that. I was really impressed with the do it yourself condiment bar. That way, I don't get onions or anything else I don't like on my burger. I have to mention that I took mine to go and it was still intact and not soggy when I got it home (when the 38 finally came).
author: Lindsey S.

description: Considering that they serve Niman Ranch burgers, this place is a steal! There is a salad bar-like topping station so you can add your own toppings to your burger, including pineapple (yum). The staff are very nice as well.
author: V R.

description: After a night of heavy drinking, burgers sounded pretty appetizing... So Belly Burger it is! My friend and I didn't want to spend a whole lot of money so that's why we choose this place. I say $10.84 for a bacon cheeseburger combo isn't bad. For a Sunday around 1pm... there wasn't much of a crowd at all. The girl at the counter was very nice and delivered speedy service. The wait for our food was around 10 minutes, not long at all. They give you a plain burger so you can choose what you want to put on it. The meat tasted fresh, but the bacon was a little undercooked. We were really looking forward to the sweet potato fries, but they did not live up to our expectation. I felt like they should have cut it into thinner pieces and it was lacking flavor. It was also very soft.. I was expecting a crunchy outside and a soft inside. Oh well though, at least I know where not to buy sweet potato fries from. Anyways, I like how they take phone orders so if you are ever in a rush, you can just walk in and pick up your food to-go. Other than burgers, they also sell hot dogs and corn dogs.. which I think is pretty awesome. The restaurant itself is fairly tiny so I can see how it can get packed easily. There is a TV inside so you have something to do while you wait for you food. But yes, over all this is a decent burger joint. It's reasonably priced and the food is satisfying. It's definitely worth giving a try!
author: Rosa L.

description: all around best fast food place in this neighborhood. natural, fresh beef, add all your own toppings, onion rigs to die for, root beer floats, and a sweet little outdoor hanging area. in this sushi ghetto that is the richmond, this is the fucking bomb.
author: Kira M.

description: mmmm realllly good burgers.  best burgers in the area to my knowledge.  burgers are fresh and there's a full salad/condiment bar for you to add as much of whatever to however you like your burger.  you'll find yourself extremely full and in a food coma state after finishing their big juicy satisfying burgers.  cute friendly service is also a plus.
author: Amanda N.

description: Great place in the neighborhood to take the kids.  They pretty much can't get into too much trouble there.  There is no wait staff to trip over them.  It isn't fancy at all, so the kids really fit in.  They have a patio in the back for sunny days.  The mini burger is only $3.50.  You can add pineapple and cucumbers and a few other kid friendly toppings.   The cashier even scrambled an egg for my two-year old!  I would like to see more healthy options for kids and a highchair that doesn't take an engineer to open.
author: Amber K.

description: Nothing really to write home about.  I was bummed because the name just makes you really smile.  I mean common, 'Belly burger'.  The taste was okay, the service was super slow, and the way they make their hambergers, the smoke that comes from the grill sort of comes out in the dining area.  I came home and my roomates commented that I smelled like smoke or bbq.  The staff was super short handed, but however very nice.  I mean I realize it's just a burger place, and it's nothing really fancy.  But I consider myself to be a low- maintenance, and this was a let down.
author: Jeremy V.

description: Belly Burger is a family owend business that on a consistent basis serves clean fresh food in a traditional burger atmosphere. Prices are reasonable. This is a staple in a great neighborhood!
author: Joanna W.

description: I ate here for the first time, and had actually been wanting to try it.  It's lame but I kept seeing ads in SF Weekly for this place, so my interest was piqued.  The joint has an almost retro-50's diner vibe- but no stools, no Moxie and none of those goofy little hats they wear- and an unusually U-shaped "help yo'self" fixins bar chock full of fresh sliced veggies (3 lettuce types!), salad fixins (?) and a butt-load of condiment options.  Strange, but I wasn't even sure if I'm allowed on the other side of the bar... where the soda fountain is... it looks like the workers' side of the counter... can I go there, dude?  Anyway, I didn't.  I got the BBQ Cheeseburger.  To some surprise, the cashier/server/cook/owner (?) brought out our burgers on these GIANT round plates.  They looked like HUGE upside-down frisbees, and my burger looked so teeny sitting there in all it's bbq'd glory.  I wasn't impressed though.  To me, my burger (the-non-natural-beef-for-an-extra-75-cent-kind) tasted like a store bought frozen patty with store bought bottled bbq sauce (which was slathered liberally, btw)  I added a bunch of veggies though, so it wasn't awful.  The dude I met up with later recommended Bill's Burgers around the corner.  Shameless, I know.
author: M S.

description: The burgers are very good. Much better than Sliders. I've eaten here quite often when I want to order for take out. However, the last time I went the guy at the counter (who I later found was the owner) was a jerk. If you want a good burger give them a shot. I personally won't go back because the owner was a rude debbie downer.
author: Ronnie M.

description: when it comes to how my burger is prepared i am VERY picky. i like the bun to be slightly toasted with butter which it is here. i can't stand american cheese so i love that i can order cheddar here! when you order the avocado burger they hook it up! the avocado is soo fresh and perfectly cut so it doesn't fall off the burger. i loove the fact that i can put my own toppings on because i can pick the freshest ones and put however much on as i want! all the toppings are extremely fresh by the way. there are three types of lettuce, three types of onions, a bunch of other toppings to choose from, and the tomatoes are big. the patty is substantial and juicy. they even have a cute retro decor and cute back patio. if you're in the richmond you must try this place! -1 star because the only thing that perplexes me is the sign that says 100% pure beef 75 cents extra.................?
